text:
I got the "Our Burger" for take out - which if I remember correctly it consisted of lettuce, tomato, pickles, patty and some sauce....

How can you call yourself a burger joint when you eff up the patty?!! It was OVERCOOKED, there's a difference between medium cooked and still juicy vs OVERCOOKED and dry af. The same thing happened to 2 of my other coworkers as well so it didn't happen to just me. Not going back!

Let's preface this with the fact that burgers are not on the top of my favourite foods list.

Ordered the melt which is almost $11 without fries which cost another $3.50.
SO ordered the original upped to 8oz patty with tater tots.

Service is friendly and prompt.  We received our drinks timely and the food didn't take that long to come out.  some of the other reviews commented on small portions.  We found all the food tasty and the portions were a good size and more than filling for an average appetite.  The melt was a perfectly toasted bread sandwiching a juicy patty with american cheese (they call it government cheese), pickles, onions, and mustard.  The fries were perfectly crispy and the tater tots were equally crispy and tasty.

The bill was $40 before tip for 2 soft drinks, 2 burgers, and fries and tater tots.  Yes, seems a bit pricey but it is downtown pricing and it is Wahlburgers.  I would say the burgers are better than Burger Works but not nearly as good as Burgers Priest if you're looking for comparisons.

On our way to the Blue Jays game my friend Bobby and I decided we would make my wife jealous and hit up Wahlburgers. It was a great experience that I would recommend to anyone.

They have a nice little restaurant on Blue Jays Way near the Rogers Center. It has a nice design with an eat in area in the front and take out at the back near the kitchens. They also have a small balcony area for take out people to eat if there is room. We didn't want to wait for a table so we headed to the back for takeout.

I ordered the Double Decker and Fries while Bobby had the OFD (Originally from Dorcester) and some Tater Tots. We both really enjoyed our food. Everything was really fresh and tasted great. Next time I think I will get the triple because I was still a little hungry but that's my fault for not getting enough.

We were lucky enough to score a table upstairs to eat so we hung out, ate and watched the Jays fans make their way to the game. I will definitly be eating here next time I go to a game.

Mediocre burgers that come with quite the price tag! These burgers lack the juiciness in the patty that I'm looking for and is very messy to eat! I get that it's finger food the proportion of sauce just isn't right.

The fries with the wahl sauce (or whatever it's called) was meh. The fries were not fresh and lack that crisp I was looking for.  

This place is gimmicky and people come here because of the Mark wahlburg name. If I had the option to come back here again, I probably wouldn't and rather go to Holy Chuck or something.

Just grabbed take out because my boyfriend was craving burgers.. we'd never been to Walburgers before, so we thought we'd give it a shot. 
We were severely disappointed. I ordered the "our" burger and it was overcooked to the point it was dry as dust. I'm usually pretty easy to please when it comes to dining out.. but this was exceptionally bad. 
My boyfriend's burger was slightly more edible. He had the BBQ burger. He also ordered a side of Mac and cheese that resembled soup with bread crumbs and bacon on top. 
Our food was clearly reheated and not made to order, as the cooks in the back seemed more interested in socializing and watching whatever was on TV than cooking. 

Really really disappointed.

I was very disappointed.

Not impressed with the decor. The prices, including the drink menu, were on the high end of average. The place seemed to want to have a home-y feel, but it just didn't. Plastic green chairs don't seem to work with $15 drinks- it just seemed gimmicky. Pictures of the Wahlburgs everywhere, obviously, and TVs playing clips from Mark's movies. I don't know what else I expected, but it seemed a little weird.

Food- the food actually was good. The burger, which was around $11, was fantastic! It didn't come with sides, which made it overpriced. The group I was with got tater tots and onion rings as sides. The tater tots were good, the onion "rings" were actually the kind of crispy onions that are supposed to go on a burger. Good, but hard to eat? 

The 2 stars were for the very good burger, the three missing are for the service. The server forgot both of our sides. She mentioned that they had just opened, which I totally understand, but her forgetting to put in half of what we ordered has nothing to do with them just opening. Their debit machine was down for a few minutes- THAT is 100% not her fault. Putting the order in was. Service was also slow, and we'd been finished for at least 15 minutes before anyone came to see if we were done, wanted a bill, etc.

Also, 18% service charge. Really? Someone below said that if you complain about 18% you shouldn't be eating there, but I disagree- it's the principle. I always try to tip decently well. (Management wise- I wonder if the servers SEE all of those tips.....) 

I would go again for take out only. Not to dine in. And even so, for the price, I'd probably end up elsewhere.
Went here because of the TV show. Now that I've been there I don't think I'd go back.  Burgers are decent but overpriced.

Came here on a Sunday evening with my family with 2 small kiddies. The space easily accommodated us and our stroller. Ambience and staff were easy going.

We ordered the "our burger", the Dorchester, sweet tots and onion rings. We loved the "our burger" and ended up ordering another round of the our burger. (Definitely could easily eat 2 burgers). The first "our burger" was cooked medium to medium well on some areas, which OK considering it was stated on the menu that, that's how it's cooked. However I would of liked it if it were either consistently medium or consistently medium well... Not just different areas! Also the onion rings (as stated on the menu)... Umm I expected rings not shreds of deep fried onion. Wasn't sure how to eat it... Went from eating few shreds of a time by hand to using a fork, which wasn't very effective. Beware of the "onion rings". The sweet tots were ok. Overall, the "our burger" stood out the most.

It took quite a longer time than the usual fast paced burger joints to get our burgers served. However the staff were friendly. 

It's a good place to hang with friends and watch a game and good enough to bring your family.

Good burger (Our Burger), better than I expected.  Very good light bun and good beef.

The restaurant was very busy on a Saturday afternoon, which made the service very slow.

I would go back and try a different burger.

Okay, had no idea this was a thing. Of all celebrities to have a restaurant chain, I think Mark Whalburg would have been the last one I would have guessed.
That aside, my husband and I would recommend the poutine, and the sweet tater tots were amazing. 
Bathrooms are on the second floor.

After all the hype about this restaurant and based on its location in the SOHO Hotel one would expect this burger joint would be something exciting to experience, well it is not! Instead this place was one of the most disappointing places I have ordered food from. We placed a phone in order and went to pick it up for 4 adults and two children. The person who picked it up asked if the staff could double check the order  to make sure the order was complete. Well many things were missing. This was one person returning to our room with many bags. They could packed the numerous bags in one larger one making it easier to carry but they did not. They missed out on all the condiments and I mean all. Not even a napkin was offered. On the menu it states all their burgers are topped with dill pickles, cheese, lettuce, tomato and onion. Well ours came with none of these things. The meat was too salty. The food was given to us cold. The tater tots are pictured with dipping sauces which were not offered. There were no lids on the tater tots allowing them to get cold quickly on the walk from the restaurant through the hotel back to our room. The grilled cheese sandwiches ordered came as one grilled cheese. We had two kids to feed. The only thing decent was the Macaroni salad.
When you are paying $10.00 for a hamburger or more you expect more than your average burger. We were all very disappointed in the food and service. We will not be returning to this place again.

Meh. 

Not at all what I expected (I don't really know WHAT I was expecting...) but I do like that they have dining with a BAR up front and your typical take away in back.

That's where the positives stop. The burger is dry with zero flavour. I'm all about showcasing the meat flavour in a good piece of beef but these aren't so go ahead and throw some s&p on that sucker.  

Really nice staff and the tots are top notch (but you can't really eff up tots so...)
Worst burger in town. Way over priced. Shitty sides and the burgers were small and not good. It's a shrine for Marky mark and more or less a tourist attraction thst sucks. Never going back.

Woth the $14+ for lunch.  Nope. I was the only person in the take out line at lunch time.  After ordering their most basic burger and an order of fries.  I asked the cashier what "government" cheese was..I was embarrassed for her when she mumbled.. sans emotion  "it's a Kraft single" .  After ordering, I waited and waited and waited.  As the cashier tapped her pen on the counter I interupted her daydream to ask if there was any faster service for take out orders or am I in line with all the dining room orders (btw the dining room was quite full) Her response was simple.  No faster service for take out.  Great so I continued to wait with anticpation. When I got back to the office and opened the box, I was horrified to see a shrivelled bun with what I think was a hamburger patty. Was too small to actually tell.  Save your money people of Toronto.  Even if the food was good (and the cheese was actually cheese) I would avoid this place with their lack lustre service and unfriendly staff.  Walberg family, you can do better.

I am only giving one star because they don't give the option for no stars. I was extremely disappointed in my experience here. I live in Detroit and frequent the location in Greektown. The people are always so nice and attentive and prompt. This is the same behavior I expected while in Toronto but I didn't receive that. We were staying in the adjoining hotel, The Soho Metropolitan for my birthday which is July 6th. My boyfriend went to the location on July 5th and arrived at 9:54pm. He asked the hostess, who was actually really nice, if they were closed and could he order food. Her response was absolutely. He said okay, and proceeded to the line to order food. The person taking the order asked was it for here or to go, his response was "here". The cashier looks at him and says, "You do realize we close in 5 minutes?" My boyfriend responds, "I just asked the girl at the door if it was okay to order food and she said yes." The girl responds, "Well we aren't allowed to tell you that you can't come in if it's before we close." He says okay and proceeds to order the food. He orders two sandwiches and two orders of fries both with the pickles on the side. When they called him, we noticed the food in a bag. I said, "Oh you ordered it to go?" He says no. He walks over the girl gives him a weird look when he said I thought I told u for here. While we were figuring out what sandwich goes to who he realized there was only one side of pickles. He goes back and says can I have another side of pickles. She asks for the pickles and the cook in back yells, "Kitchen's closed." Now, my boyfriend owns a bar, ironically, a burger bar. So he knows how things should be handled in this situation, so he gets upset. He says to the cook, "Well had you done it right the first time I wouldn't have to come back and ask for anything." The cook says something that I couldn't hear and my boyfriend says, "I can't believe how rude you people are." There were two ladies sitting in a booth near the counter and kitchen and one speaks up. My boyfriend asks if she is management. She asks what's the problem, he asks again if she is management and she respond yes. He says, "Your employees are rude. If they didn't want to serve us they should have said that when I arrived and asked about ordering. They didn't give me my order correct. I ordered it for here, they give it to me in bags, and now your cook is yelling from the back of the house. It's extremely rude." She responds, "Well sir, the cooks are rude to us too." He said, "Well you need to fire them. I own a bar and this behavior would never be tolerated." He then tells me we can go eat elsewhere after I apologized for suggesting we go in the first place. We left without even touching the food. He tells the manager have a nice night and we leave. We paid $35.31 for a meal we couldn't even enjoy, $20 of it was in USD, which makes it actually $41.07 paid. Its super upsetting that while on vacation for my birthday, going to a place I usually love to go to, this happens. I definitely have no desire to return.

Decided to check Wahlburgers out last night while my family is in the city. My brother-in-law is a fan of the show and I thought he'd get a kick out of being there. 

The place was packed and loud, but we were seated immediately and our initial server was great at telling us about he menu. He was quick to mention that the 18% surcharge on cocktails has been discontinued because customers were not happy with it. No shit!

There were 4 of us, a child and three adults. We each ordered something different, the Smallburger combo for my nephew $5.95, which includes fries. Then an Our Burger, the Crispy Haddock Sandwich, and the OFD. Sides were tatter tots, onions rings and, sweet potato tatter tots.  I also ordered a margarita and my sister ordered a Ceasar, both $12 each. 

We got our food orders fairly quickly. The Sides were the only decent things served. The haddock sandwich was burnt to within an inch of its life. Not worth the $ don't believe the hype.

An interesting place. Kind of more an upscale sports bar and I always like a place that puts their own personal flair into it. One entire wall of the place is to list all of the tv and movies the Wahlbergs have been in. Food was great, had a Basic Burger with fries and it was fresh and delicious. My friend did not care for the onion rings as they are not rings but more like small curls and more crunchy. The staff were pretty bland and had little energy. Overall, delicious!

If you want a good burger, AVOID. This is literally a pimped up mcdonalds. The buns are severely fake. The meat is absolutely tasteless and you don't feel the same grilled meat taste as with Hero Burger. I was asked if I wanted cheese and I was given the options. I then asked for the white cheddar and was told that is $1.30 extra. Quite a lot for a transparent piece of cheese. Anyway, I didn't want to pay, so I settled for the regular American cheese. Big mistake. This is the same plastic sad excuse for cheese they put on mcdonalds. The whole burger was really bad and I ended up throwing 2\/3rds of it away. I also ordered a poutine with the Yukon Gold Fries. The poutine was also pretty bad. Very cheap on the cheese curds, the gravy was too thick and strange and the fries were not nice at all. They just have a slightly nicer presentation than mcdonalds which is why it seems popular. I spent $17 and threw most of it in the garbage.

Very unimpressive... I ordered a steam whistle, for $7.50 it came in a pop glass and wasn't close to being a pint.... I got the the regular burger $9.95 with tater tots $3.50, tater tots were okay but bland, the burger was bad, very tiny with more condiments then beef, I had a good quarter of my bun left and no beef, the government cheese was terrible and I like processed cheese. The bartender was nice and gave me their secret sauce, the sauce was really good.  I am a huge fan of works burger, the burgers are huge and delicious with endless fries, a way better value and just up the street. Don't waste your time here, friendly staff but the food is terrible!

Waste of time.  Lots of hype.  I love a good over priced burger.  And I got a dried over priced burger.   My burger had a fried egg on it.   Omg.  The egg was dry.  I sent it back.  Still dry.  They are not that good.  My daughter  ordered a hotdog.  She needed to kill it in ketchup to eat it.  The fries are really good the fries get a 4 star the restaurant  gets a 2.  You are better off ordering the takeout and eating upstairs.

Great food and service, good atmosphere, consistent design. Decent food pricing for downtown toronto although simple carbonated beverages have a 250% markup!

My only real complaint would be that its overly dedicated to Actor Mark Wahlberg. His face and "accomplishments" are plastered all over the place. Comes off as a bit arrogant, but hey when you're Mark, I guess you could whatever you please, heh.

Would def visit again to try the other menu items! Recommend.

It's not terrible but it's not great.  They messed up our order and before I knew it, I was half way done my buddy's burger - the original BBQ cheese one when I really wanted to try the OFD.  The patty was a tad on the small side and wasn't very juicy.  In fact, it was a bit overcooked and didn't taste as fresh like some other gourmet burger places.  The bun has some greasy layer on it, I prefer a more doughy bun to be honest.  The topping selections for each burger were good though.  Nice to have something unique like a Thanksgiving burger as an option, same with Turkey vs. Beef.  

The atmosphere was like a sportsbar and it was packed with people on a Saturday night.  You can tell people were excited to try out a new place.  I'd say the quality is definitely above McDonalds but below say a Burger's Priest.  Something in the middle, something average.  I also had the sweet potato tots which were nice and a Sam Adams Boston Lager, which was also nice for a change.  Prices were what one would expect for King West.  I could eat here again but I won't be rushing back anytime soon.  I could see out of town people eating here before\/after a Jay game.
Rude waiters , did not make eye contact. Gave off the impression that they didn't want anyone there. But good food over all
Toronto's version of Shake Shack. Overpriced burgers. Service is slow and usually a long line. It's what you expect.

Had the Thanksgiving turkey burger. Burger didn't taste fresh. In fact, the burger came out in record time which further makes me believe it wasn't fresh. There was very little sauce and stuffing in the burger. The sweet potato tots weren't cooked thoroughly either. In conclusion, there are better options in the city for the price point that Wahlburgers is in.

The wave of negative review is a bit surprising as this place serves half decent burgers. The place is a mad house in terms of the crowds with lineups over half and hour or so even at off peak hours. My experience was for a takeout so will reserve the comment for service in house till I have dined in.
My friend likes Turkey burgers and with the recent review by a fellow Yelper (Thanks Billy K for cutting through the riff raff and providing an honest review) for Thanks Giving burger this was the choice we stuck with. We ordered a kids burger (beef) as the third person dining with us wanted a small portion (great value as its comes with a choice of a side) for sides we had sweet potato tots, onions and fries. 
The order took its time (15-20 min) and when we opened up the food at home it was still warm. 
On to the burgers nicely done a big pattie covered with stuffing. We also had caramelized onions as topping which went well.  Decent burger I would say 3 stars. I didn't try the beef burger but the person who tried it liked it as well. Sides were decent too with sweet potato tots being the crowd pleaser.  3 stars all said and done. The place does seem overwhelmed and I hope they will streamline soon in house.

Went for the first time. Was seated quickly even though the restaurant was busy. Ordered the burger and fries and they were fantastic. The burgers were very juicy, cooked perfectly and the sea salt fries were tasty. Our server Sophie was fast and friendly. The only problem I have was the portion size. The amount of fries you get is about avg with anywhere else however I found the burgers to be rather small and was left hunger after the meal.

Food: We ordered "Our Burger" we modified it to our liking for toppings and the wahl sauce was amazing! We both ordered chocolate frappes they were rich but very good! 

Service: When we first arrived, it was about a 30 minute wait to be seated, they were asking for phone numbers so that they could text you when your table was ready. We haven't been able to receive texts while I'm Canada so the hostess advised that it was no problem as long as we were staying close she would come find us.  About 30-35 minutes later we were seated, they gave us 2 options for seating because of my husbands wheelchair. We chose option 2 it was near the window and was much more accessible. When our server came the great service continued. She was kind, quick, and familiar with everything. 

Only one disappointment with this was that we wanted a shot glass a momento and the mgr advised that they've not had them since December. Time to take them off the board I think!

Lunchtime. 

Well what to say about this place. 
One its owned by a famous person which brought me here. 
Two l love the food here it's alway fresh and on time. Their garden salad are my favorite with a chicken burger.

Really good food and service. The thanksgiving day burger is delicious. The atmosphere inside is a bit weird with the bright green chairs but the food and service makes that better. The fries are really good as well.

I have been twice now and I will continue to go back. There food is AMAZING I had the Jenn chicken Burger and fries and I have had the Our Burger and sweet potato tots !!! Very nice inside and friendly workers ! Can't wait to go back

Underwhelming. Portions small. Burgers lackluster. Atmosphere touristy. Just build the price of fries into the meal cost. Nobody wants to pay $12 for a sub-par burger and then have to pitch an extra $3.00 for a meager side of fries.

Was curious to see what the fuss was about. Will not be going back.

I stopped into Wahlburgers for lunch on a sunday afternoon just after it opened for the soft opening but before the grand opening.  The staff were young and friendly and efficient.  The atmosphere is a family sports bar.  The burgers were fresh, simple but full of flavour.  I had the tater tots instead of fries.  They were good but a side sauce would have made them better.  Overall a nice place to grab a burger with friends.

I met a buddy here for lunch.  I tried to keep my mind open given the ridiculous hoopla around the A&E show and hype in general.

It's a much larger space than I thought.  There are two floors, a bar area, an open kitchen and lots and lots of very green chairs. 

TV's broadcast various sports programs but you can always be assured the Wahlberg montage will be in rotation which features the best of Donny, Mark and whatever the other guy's name is. 

The servers seem to forget they work in a burger joint in a tourist area and not a hole in the wall on Ossington. Just because you are wearing  black T-shirt, it doesn't mean you need to act like WE should feel privileged to be there.  At least the shirts aren't green though....

As for the food, the burger was good. I went with the Bacon BBQ.  The meat\/bun ratio was good and the patty was an acceptable medium-well (although I really wasn't asked).  I liked the Wahl sauce and BBQ sauce, both of which I asked for on the side.

As for the sides, they were terrible.  The fries and tots were synonymous with something my daughters would heat up after school. 

It's good in that you can sit and have a beer with a burger and watch television which is a surprising rarity among many of the popular joints in the downtown core. That said, you can get a good microbrew as long as you want to pay at least $7 for it. It's a bit ironic considering their menu concept which promises a reflection of humble beginnings and government cheese. I'd think a Bud Light might be a better call.

The concept is a little confused.  It can't seem to decide if it wants to be a chic burger bar or a family joint where you can get food made by famous people at a somewhat reasonable price. My guess is that Wahlburgers will likely draw the baseball crowd more than it will the patrons of the SOHO.

I think I could replicate my experience with a green sharpie highlighter, a pound of hamburger, a Kraft single, a bag of McCain fries\/tots and a toaster oven while   watching Muchmusic retro while I talk to my annoying hipster cousin on speaker phone.

Stuck between 2 and 3 stars but the burger saved it.

With burger joints like Burger's Priest and P & L burger in town, I think this new kid will get knocked off the block pretty quick.

I should first write that I had no idea that there was a tv show surrounding this restaurant. They did show the tv show inside the restaurant; well, the 15 second preview on repeat for the entire time.

That said, the place is SO OVERPRICED. For two drinks and two burgers, our bill was $60. Also, there is a MANDATORY 18% gratuity. Even if you only eat as a couple, like us.

While the food was overall good, albeit fairly average, two things irked me. First, their "pints" are not pints. They are glass-sized bottles. $7 for a pint is steep; $7 for considerably less than a pint is scandalous.

The second thing is the mixed drinks: all are $12, and to be honest, it was not only garbage, but it came in a champagne glass. For $12, I would have expected a drink twice that side.

Part of me thinks the prices are so ludicrous because of the tv show. Maybe. Maybe this restaurant is a cash grab on hype. Maybe take your $60 and go to one of many better, more affordable, non-mandatory gratuity joints in Toronto instead.

So disappointed. If you're a NKOTB fan girl or fan of the Wahlburger show, then check it out but be prepared for lacklustre food and mediocre service. 

My out of town sister wanted to see this place since she's what I've described above haha. And I knew the minute we walked in, she wasn't the only out of towner. This place evokes the same atmosphere as Hard Rock Cafe or Niagara Falls. I wouldn't be surprised if no locals eat here. 

We were greeted at the door and explained the two different routes we could take: full, sit down service or head to the back for fast food. We chose to sit down and take in the whole experience. 

It took forever to get our drink orders in. There were probably 2-3 servers working and maybe 5-6 tables with customers but we waited really long just for the initial order. We watched customers arrive and head to back, order and head up stairs with food before we got served.

Once we did order, we found the portions small and the food mediocre. They serve the food in baskets and provide metal utensils which I found odd. The burger itself is dry and nothing special. I enjoyed eating the tater tots though they could be a bit more crispy and warm. 

Save yourself money and just head to Burger Priest or PnL for a quality burger that's probably cheaper.

Ok, I've been a few times and the bad reviews are not deserved.   

I've had several menus items and likes them all.  My favorite being Jenn's chicken sandwich.  Wow was it great.  

Service can be a little slow,  it everything is made from scratch!  What do you expect?   Totally a fun chain that people see as a novelty, but they produce quality food most of the time.  

Give it a shot, just not on a day the Jays are playing. It's packed from pregame diners.

I was disappointed with this burgers what with all the fan fare from the related television program. The plating was well done. The restaurant looked great but the burgers didn't have a memorable taste, the fries were good however.

Certainly an above average burger joint. When i walked in it seemed loud and crowded but it didn't feel claustrophobic when we sat down. The wait staff was laid back but friendly. Sports bar decor, with wall to wall flat screens showing sports and video montages. Being a Marky Mark fan, the shameless advertising didn't bother me so much as make me want to go home and netflix one of his movies.

The Menu descriptions are charming ("Triple decker: a triple stack, like the house we grew up in"). The topping combinations were appealing, I had the "OFD" with mushrooms, swiss, tomato jam and bacon, which was as you can imagine quite tasty. Poutine was good, the cheese was plentiful and the gravy was beefy. The onion rings were actually onion strings, which weren't bad, but i wouldn't choose it again. You did get a good portion size, though, since more were able to fit in the cup. 

The main thing: the patty. I have rather high standards and have never paid for one that is better than what my dad makes. But it didn't taste like a frozen or processed, it tasted like fresh ingredients. I was happy.

I left having had enjoyed myself.

Oh! and the hard plastic chairs were surprisingly comfortable!

For those of you who aren't familiar with Wahlburgers, it's a casual comfort food restaurant founded by the three Wahlberg brothers Mark, Donnie and Paul.  These talented brothers not only act, dance, sing, and have their own reality show (Wahlburgers) but they also know a thing or two about a damn good burger.  Ever since they were kids, they've always had a passion for burgers, comfort food and making girls scream (Marky Mark and the Funky Bunch YEAH!!) and so together the boys opened up their first Wahlburgers location in Hingham, MA in Oct 2011. 

The brothers were very excited to finally open their first franchise in Canada this past November 2014 inside the Soho Metropolitan Hotel making it the first North American expansion outside of the original restaurant in Hingham. The location seats 120 and offers a casual atmosphere with a sports bar, seated dining area and fast service counter. 

The menu includes a long list of burgers (custom-grind using 100 percent Canadian beef), sandwiches, salads, tater tots, fries, mom's macaroni salad, and onion rings. Alcoholic beverages are available such as as adult frappes, wahl-coctions, wine, beer and mixed drinks.  A cool feature that is available only at Wahlburgers Toronto is a beer made by Mill Street Brewery exclusive to the Toronto location, it's called the 'Wahlbrewski North' and it's one helluva an IPA!


Here's what I tried:

Thanksgiving Burger (Mark's Choice)
Fresh ground season turkey, stuffing, Paul's orange cranberry sauce, roasted butternut squash and mayo $9.95

This turkey burger isn't around just for Thanksgiving; this bad boy is always on the menu and happens to be my favourite item so far.  I usually don't order turkey burgers because they tend to be dry but this one was quite juicy and full of flavour! All of the toppings really added different flavours and textures and the combination was just incredibly delicious! The taste of the squash especially added exceptional flavour to the burger.

O.F.D (Originally from Dorchester)
8 oz. beef patty, house made tomato jam, bacon, Swiss cheese and sautéed mushrooms $11.95

This big burger was pretty good but not as flavourful as I thought it would've been. The tomato jam was good but quite mild, I would've liked a dollop of BBQ sauce to give this burger a bit of a kick.  The patty itself was thick and juicy and cooked to perfection! 

Sweet Potato Tots $3.50

These are served with a nice chipotle sauce and are pretty addictive.  I've always been a tot fan so it was nice trying them out in sweet potato form. 

Alma's Macaroni Salad
Elbow macaroni, red onion, sweet peppers, parsley & mom's creamy mayo dressing $4.50

This is a classic recipe by momma Wahlberg that the brothers loved while growing up. It was pretty basic tasting and I felt that there was not enough dressing on it.  Perhaps I just got a batch that was lacking dressing...

Truffle Cookie
Gluten-free chocolate truffle cookie $1.95

These warm little cookies look plain but TASTE amazing.  I need to figure out if I can buy these by the bag because they are ridiculously addictive.  They remind me of a flourless chocolate cake, but in a little cookie form.  Highly recommend for a sweet treat after your meal.

Overall I had a wonderful experience at Wahlburgers and everyone that worked there was a complete delight.  I would definitely return to Wahlburgers especially with friends from out of town who want a feel for the city. Starting this month Wahlburgers will incorporate Canadian-themed dishes as part of the 'burger of the month' program and hopefully when they've perfected the 'greatest poutine ever' we will see something like that on the menu.

Food quality is good but for the amount of food you get, it's not worth the price. And it is quite expensive (gourmet burger pricing). Our order of two burgers, two sides and one shake came out to over $40 for take-out.

The stand-out is really the sweet potato tots. These are truly addictive! I recently found out they increased the price from $3.50 to $4.50 without increasing the portions. They couldn't even top it off! It's such a jip and it kills me because these tots are SO good. I also liked the deep fried onions as they are stringy and not your typical thick-cut onion rings. Also had the Thanksgiving burger and double stack burger. Both were good but the size of the patties were just very sad.

A lot of reviewers mentioned confusion over the layout. Here's how it works: There is dine-in with bar service on ground level (wait to be seated). Cashiers are located all the way in the back for take-out orders. BUT there is seating upstairs for take-out orders (no table service). 

Worth trying once and see for yourself. I won't come back unless I'm desperately craving the sweet potato tots.

Had dinner here last night (Friday). We were seated right away as we came in later during the evening. The waitress was so nice and friendly. I had the Our Burger. It was delicious. There were three of us so we had 3 different sides: fries, tater tots, and crispy onion rings, all were tasty and fresh. I've read a lot of bad reviews but we have been meaning to try this place for a while and I'm sure we will be back I just hope we will see some consistency. For our first time it was excellent.

I honestly think this place deserves more than a 2.5 star review the food was great and so was the service. The only downside that I saw is that it's kinda crowded and I like my space while eating! I had the melt but modified it to my liking which didn't effect the cost at all and my partner had the eh' burger which he loved! The slightly more expensive prices were to be expected, as they are at any touristy location. Next time I take a trip to Toronto I will be returning to Wahlburgers to try something new!

Mmmm..  burger joint.

Took absolutely no time for me to settle on getting an "eh? burger" and a poutine.   After all, I'm Canadian, eh?

Last year, I learned that if a burger has an egg on it, order that burger.  Hence, the "eh?" burger.

This "eh?" burger is, by far, one of my top 5 (if not top 1) burger of all time.

If you've never had a burger with a egg on it, you haven't lived.  Lift the bun, poke the yoke and let the yoke ooze all over the burger.  Replace bun, and enjoy.

The poutine was also excellent.

Nice looking place, lots of tasty options on the menu.  Go get an "eh?" burger - I promise you won't be disappointed.
As for the burger... nothing really  to write home about, but their crispy thin onion rings were quite tasty.

I just can't believe the bad pricing that exists here.  I get it they have to pay for the high rent that Soho must charge but seriously.

The burger is decent, average at best.  The buns are thick and a bit too bready.

So I ordered a 5 oz burger with cheddar and a milkshake, which was actually pretty good.  And that's it.  No fries, no onion rings, no lobster, no filet mignon, nothing else and the price was $19.

See the picture and you decide if this is a well pricing scheme for this resto.

Obviously you can't have a burger without a beer! Pint of Mill Street organic went down really well with the "Our Burger"... a 5oz burger, lettuce, onion, "government" cheese, Paul's signature sauce & HOUSEMADE pickles ( got them on the side).  The bun is a potato bun so when you get down to the last bite...there is still lots of flavour in the bun!  Tater Tots - can't go wrong with them "Tots" (Napoleon, give me some Tots!). Overall, exceeded expectations.

Great service, great atmosphere, great meal - simple, filling and tons of flavour.

I will definitely be back and recommend to any and all.  Price is very reasonable as well. 

Awesome!

Anybody that gives this burger joint more than 2 stars is obviously a friend on the payroll of the owners.
Went there today after a Blue Jay game around 4 PM.  Never been although we live around the corner.  But, hey gotta patronize local eateries, right?
Wrong.!~!!! 
The BBQ burger at $9.95 was as dreary as all the other reviews state.
It was Luke warm, small, and covered with a few extras that were all pretty much a mush of stuff.
Bun was tiny but I guess for the tiny meat patty it was in order. The bun was above cardboard by a bit.  Totally inappropriate for a specialty place that makes a big deal about its burgers.
No plate to dip your fries in ketchup so we put a nappy on the table and poured the ketchup on it. The fries were undistinguished and don't even give Big Mac fries a run for the money.
Thank goodness for Harvey's and their affordable and wonderful meat patties and real fries.
But if you drink enough of Wahlburger's booze you might be happy with the food.

i always frequent Wahlburgers when I am in the area and the food is great. Whenever I am dined on, the service is great as well. I had recently tried the self serve option, which is a nice touch for on the go\/in a rush clients. The bar was spacious and welcoming. The atmosphere wasn't the best (a lot of really loud laughter coming from kitchen staff) but the food again was great. I had the 'Melt', which was a great twist of grilled cheese and a burger and their yummy yukon fries. There food is great and filling but the atmosphere can be improved on. I think there is a reason that many reviewers have given them 4 stars. There is always room for improvment.

This was a disappointment.
I respect Marky Mark and was hoping for the same in my burger.

Double Decker was not a delight. It seemed as if the patties were smaller than the regular patties, I'd say even slider size. Dry and not saucy - where was the sauce Mark?

Stale Buns all around. 

Tater Tots - delicious, but for $3.50 I can buy a whole McCains bag on my way home! 

Bbq Bacon -
Where do I begin. No avocado, flimsy bacon, and the same dry bun.

Not a pleasant waiting staff experience to say the least. I won't be back.

Very tasty burgers. Good service!

We tried the fries, poutine, tater-tots, my personal fav, chicken strips, fish burger and the bbq bacon burger -It's sooo good and has a kick to it!

I thought it was pricy originally, but then tried Burger's Priest, it was as expensive, the burger wasn't as good and the fries were super greasy!

The manger Alex, came by our table to say hello. She was super friendly!
Would go back, it's  friendly place for some comfort food!

Overall Wahlburger was fine. The novelty of going was fun, the burgers were fine. It was decently priced. I wouldn't make a date out of it but if you want to grab a quick and not so fancy burger, it's a good spot. 

Note: their onion rings are NOT onion rings. They were crispy onions, which is fine on a burger but don't order them as a side.

Got the double burger; was okay. More for the name than the burger.

Burger was fresh not too salty but nothing crazy that makes you want to go back.

The portion of tater tots was good but too salty. 

For the price I had better but good to try out.

For a burger place, their burgers could really use some work...

Burger sizes are a bit disappointing, patty tastes okay (bit dry, not very flavourful), and buns were atrocious (super dry, cold bottom, flaky crumbly top). It reminded me of stale 5 day old buns. 

Pass on this and take your $15 somewhere else.

Our waitress was awesome. We are having a bad day and getting held in Canada over night because of terrible porter airlines, thank goodness that we found this place and had an awesome waitress that explained a lot out the restaurant and about the history of it. She was great. And the food was great, fast and reasonable prices. Thank you.

I'm going to tell you guys right now, this is a second visit review happening right here.  The first time I went, probably a 3.  But this time...this time it's a 4 star.

Let me tell you how this went down.

I had been to Wahlburgers by myself and ordered the OUR BURGER.  That is a mistake folks.  The our burger is generic and not what you want to be tasting on in this place.

You have to try THE MELT. It's basically a Grilled Cheese Bacon Burger.  

I can't move right now and I'm pretty sure my intestines are going to shut down in a few minutes...but I'm good. 

Heaven, I'm ready for ya.

Unfortunately the service was garbage. We travel all over world and again even in Canada the employees are trashy people. The experience was nothing like what is shown on tv! We didn't even eat in the restaurant because the people were ignorant. Were hoping we will find a waulburgers that will give us the experience of the perception given. The waulburgers name is on the line and for their employees to ruin yet another good time with my family is just disappointing. Maybe the pairs location will give us what we're looking for out of the brand "waulburgers

Best burgers in town.  Savory, delicious and juicy.  The sauce !!!!
Had the triple decker (bbq bacon style)
Fish sandwich ....best in class
Onion rings (straws)

Long wait.   Staff don't drop extra partties to anticipate big lines.  They are in a zone.  

$$ on burger price.   Addons like fries, onion straws (delicious) $3.50.

Came here with my hubby and some friends, wanted to try it out since we are such huge mark Wahlburg fans. My burger, the our burger was very dry, but the sauce was good. I ordered the mud pie but it was grey not chocolate in color and did not taste like chocolate at all although clearly on their tvs in the restaurant it is chocolate colored. Def not worth 15$. 1 star for the sauce and 1 star for tater tots. Burger priest is much better than this place.

Let me start by saying that my family really enjoyed the taste of the burgers....however they are small....and crazy expensive! We are a family of 5, two teenagers and a 6 year old and we each ordered a burger and fries....no alcohol just iced tea and the bill was $100 with tip! We won't be back!
So far so good. Great clean place with some great burger selections. I had the turkey burger and bud had the melt. Both awesome. And so glad we got tater tots. So good!
It could definitely be a lot better. It wasn't horrible but it reminded me of fast food, cheap and hits the spot but not the most satisfying.

Vastly overrated. Went with a couple friends this weekend and was so disappointed. The layout is very modern and hip but other than that everything else was disappointing. The food is overpriced and don't even think about ordering any alchohol because the prices are a joke. I believe a bottle of beer goes there for 8 bucks... The burger I ordered was good but not great. The service there was terrible too don't get me started on that. Hundreds of better burger joints in toronto that are way cheaper and better than this one don't let yourself get fooled by the hype.

Loved the food, was fresh and hot. Loved the tater tots and Burger was really good. Staff were friendly and helpful. Portion size I found was good, as there was more than enough tater tots for my boyfriend & I to share. Come early if you want to avoid waiting in line like we did. Got right in and didn't have to wait. 

A good tip we got from someone is to eat in the upstairs take out area to save $ on the 18% gratuity. 

Some on here in their reviews have mentioned about the prices being gourmet Burger priced. Ummm it's a gourmet Burger place so I would expect to pay these prices. At Kelsey's, and this isn't a gourmet Burger place, with a burger fries and drink it would be about the same price. Not much difference. 

Wahlburgers had great food and service, will definitely come again.

Not the best, not the worst. Decent. Got the bacon burger (turkey, no cheese). Enjoyable but VERY small for the price. I was expecting more. I was definitely still hungry afterwards. Service also was decent - not a bad experience but they could have been better. Also found food took long to come out. Wouldn't be in a rush to come back but I wouldn't be opposed to it either. If I come back, then I wouldn't do the dining area again.

Hello Yelp,

It's been far too long. I've missed you so much but I'm back.

I remember when I first heard about Wahlburgers, Thanksgiving weekend 2014, while watching a 24 hour marathon highlighting the beautiful Wahlberg family on Bravo! 

Needless to say when I found out there was a Wahlburgers coming to Toronto months and months ago I knew I had to go. I mean c'mon! This is a family that pisses success. Mark had Planet of the Apes and Fear, Donnie has Saw and Blue Bloods and surely Paul would have hamburgers (and accoutrements). 

However, I never was able to find time to take a trip to Wahlburgers. That all changed tonight when a few co-workers (maybe someday full blown friends?) and I went after work!

This burger is "A-OK" (as yelp! described my choice of a 3 star review). The burgers are more or less on par for the price point of a small chain burger in the area. You're looking at roughly 15-20 dollars for a combo which is expensive but at this point I'm sure you're used to it. They have some unique options and a lot more poultry than you'll see at other burger places in the area. Their choice in salads and "tots" is also a nice change that I'm sure is tasty. I tried neither but the onion skins were delicious if not a tad greasy.

At the end of the day Wahlburgers gets the job done and is LLBO. The fact remains that their are too many 4 and 5 star options around for me to go back any time soon.

Service was excellent, but food was okay. I ordered the lobster burger and the burger was just lacking alot of flavor and the portion sizes were not that large as well.
Nothing spectacular for the price.

Sooooo excited to have finally tried this place. I'm a diehard NKOTB fan so, quite obviously, once I heard that Donnie, Paul and Mark were going to expand their chain all of the way up here to Toronto- the countdown commenced..... more than once because the opening date kept changing, but whatever.
Anyways. The day came. I had checked out the menu online, so I knew roughly what to expect. The restaurant is clean and bright with lots of homages to the two celebrity brothers plastered all over the walls and televisions. It's fast food meets sports bar meets cafeteria meets sit-down restaurant. Nice, casual vibe with friendly staff- but the seating is lacklustre and spaced a little too closely together. The seats are lime green and feel cheap. They sell merchandise, but it's nothing special and slightly overpriced.
Now- down to the food. 
Firstly- it came quickly. No more than 10 mins tops.
My boyfriend had a burger with sweet tater tots and I had the melt sandwich with French fries.
Burger- flavour was good, bun was good, meat was slightly overlooked and dry. 7\/10.
Tater tots- slightly warmer than room temperature and wish they had a crispier texture. 7.5\/10
The Melt- 10\/10. One of the bed sandwiches\/burgers I've ever had in my life. 
Fries- comparable to Burger King. Crispy and flavourful but over-salted. 7.5\/10

I would 100% go back and try something new. I think it's adorable that they have their mother's pasta salad as a menu item. Jenny McCarthy also has a chicken sandwich on the menu. Too bad I hate Jenny McCarthy.

An automatic 18% gratuity is added to the bill, so just don't be surprised when you see that circled in pen by your waitress when it's presented to you.

Very hesitant upon coming in because of passed reviews we have read, but decided to give it a chance anyways. We came in on this passed Friday night. As soon as we walked in it seemed to be not the busiest night but still full enough. We saw 2 hostesses seating and clearing tables which we later got their names on the way out because of their exceptional customer service in dealing with my family. The hostess that was what looked like stationed at the door failed to pay us any mind and seemed to be holding more of a personal conversation with her what seemed to be her boyfriend. We wandered for a minute wondering where to go until both of the other hostesses immediately ran over to see if we were helped. And promptly cleared and sat us at a booth in the back and apologized on the confusion and even gave us recommendations on what we're their favorites. 

Our great server Bianca came over within 5 minutes to take our drink order and asked if we were ready to order or needed some time. She quickly returned back with our drinks. The food came within reasonable time. The BBQ bacon burger was what I expected and I was not disappointed. My wife got the same and my son got the children's chicken fingers which came in a much larger portion then I thought and was very pleased with that. The remainder of our night was enjoyable, our server and the two vibrant hostesses we spoke with early came to check on us and see if we had everything we needed and how the food was. 

Overall I would recommend people to come dine in and experience wahlburgers. I will be coming back with my family. I just wanted to write a review to change the bad rep that's been put on wahlburgers.

There is absolutely no value in eating here.  Where ever they can they cut corners and charge too much.
Lets start with the fries for $3.50 you would expect a full container but instead they serve you a half full cup of fries.  Potatoes are the cheapest thing you can serve...why do they feel it necessary to skimp so much?
Next the burger.  Decent size but not large by any ones standards.  Really no flavour to it.  I had bacon and cheese on mine and I think there was only once piece of bacon and not a lot of cheese.  For some reason they butter the bun so it is unnecessarily greasy which is too bad because its actually a decent bun.  I spend about $20 on a burger, fries and fountain drink and left disappointed with the food.  If you are going to charge $10 for a burger you better make it a lot better than that.
In general the place is clean and there are lots of places to seat.
I will not go again.

After much hype, Wahlburgers has come to town.

Yes, it's in the Soho Hotel, around the corner from Luckee. Yes, it's the new hot thing. But sadly, no, it's not that great.

So just to be clear, there's nothing particularly wrong with it (unless you count the rotund fellow wearing a FORD NATION shirt, while chowing down with his family. But seriously, there's nothing "wrong with it." The burgers seem fresh, the buns are fine and everything is just, well, fine. But that's the thing - they are not particularly flavourful or there is nothing about the meat or the sandwich that screams "THIS IS A WAHLBURGER!" If I was to blind taste test a series of burgers I would not know I had one.

We tried the BBQ burger, which came highly recommended, with the sweet potato tots and macaroni salad on the side. I think the macaroni salad was my favourite thing we ate. It tasted like it had been made from scratch, not too much mayo. Just fresh. Good.

Pricewise, the burgers seem pretty reasonable at about $9.75 each but none come with a side, not even fries. So if you want a burger and, oh I don't know, maybe some fries, expect to pay the usual overpriced Toronto standard of $15 and up.

Another thing that was sort of presumptuous was that 18% gratuity is added to any and all bills. The service wasn't bad, other than a mix up that had the food runner "selling" our plate because he didn't know what table to bring it to, but it would have been nice to know before ordering that 18% was being tacked on just for transparency's sake.

There are TVs all around the restaurant and at the bar that show basically one of two things: sports games and clips from the Wahlburgers reality show on a loop. It didn't appear that anyone who was in the restaurant gave a dingo's kidneys about either. I mean, it's in the tony Soho hotel so that doesn't exactly scream Boston sports bar. This is Toronto baby; we're too cool for everything.

I guess final verdict is that in a city that is so inundated with burger joints, one would thing that Wahlburgers would bring something more to the table other than the fact that it bears the name of the Wahlbergs.

Very good burgers being a person that lives in the suburbs, I was downtown last weekend for the whole weekend at the MTCC and I ate at Wahlburgers every day. The portobello cap burger and the 1\/3 melt were my favorite. Will definitely go there again.
We went to this place when we in Toronto. We got seated pretty quickly. Took a few minutes for the server to come over it wasn't busy. The food was average wasn't nothing special overly priced

Service was friendly and staff were knowledgable.

Burgers were on point!! 

Everything on the menu looked so yummy I struggled to decide.

I had the "Eh" burger. It was so so good. Meat was fresh and perfectly cooked, and the peameal bacon, egg and other toppings complimented each other very well. Love the mustard sauce in there!

Sides were also yummy, tater tots, fries and the onion rings (not your standard thick round onion rings but instead thin, strip like onion pieces) a nice variation and surprisingly good.

Friend had the Thanksgiving burger which he said was great and a nice change from the usual. 

Highly recommend if you are looking for a quick easy, no fuss meal.

Knew what to expect coming here. People say high prices and service fees. But they told us the 18% is waived now. They heard the reviews!

The Our Burger, Paul's choice!. It may look small and at 5oz it's not big but I don't think it's small either. A local gourmet burger joint I'd say is what everyoe compares burgers to these days comes out at 4oz so it's bigger than them. Thing is 'gourmet: burgers are tall, not flat. If they were flat, you'd get a bigger bun.

People ask well how does it compare to this 'gourmet' burger? Well I think the bun holds up better. And it's quote tasty so I like it.

The issue here is that Wahlburgers is not sure whether they are gourmet or fast food. Sit down or take out. So I sit down, the service is quite good and attentive. They serve the burgers in a basket which is indicative of takeout I think. So at this price point you don't want to feel like it's takeout. They have tater tots and sweet potato tater tots. I personally like the tater much more than the sweet potato ones. The sweet potato ones are more sweet than expected. Don't forget about the buffalo sauce, it's a great dip.

They seem to have difficulty finding space for a group of 6. Their tables just are not made for this; generally for 2s and 4s. So they could figure that out.

Also, it says it's child friendly and they do have high chairs and booster seats. But no table for changing in the restrooms.

I think if they figure out what they are it'll do fine. It's a bit expensive for fast food, but if they can figure out how to make it not feel fast food then the price point is quite competitive. Burgers do taste good, I like the tater tots. Fries looked good too! And make sure to not retract the waiving of 18% service charge, I want my choice in what tip to give.
Felt like frozen burgers thawed and fried. Might not have been but felt that way. Mediocre. Sorry that's just what I feel.

Mark Wahlburg's restaurant. Been wanting to visit for a while to see if the food is any good. We had the fried onion rings and they were the ultra thin strand ones and full of flavour. No need to add more seasoning as the salt and pepper was just right. The burger we chose was the classic "Our Burger". It was juicy and flavourful but much smaller than your average restaurant burger.

Three stars. Plus one for really good service. It was a quiet Sunday evening during the visit and the restaurant was mostly empty.

Over priced frozen burgers. Stale buns, wilted brown lettuce. McDonald's type service and quality. Hey Wahlberg brothers stick to television and film leave the food industry to those who take pride in it...

We attended about 2 hours before the jays home opener so expected it to be busy. Greater was miserable very slow and disorganized. Took 30 minutes to get a table even though at least 4 tables remained empty. Restaurant was clean and well decorated. Our server was extremely helpful, fast and efficient. Bucket of beer for $20 was a nice surprise. The food was excellent well cooked and arrived within 10 minutes of ordering. Onions rings \/ straws are fantastic. Was about the same price as eating McDonald's. Overall highly recommend.

Wow this place is pretty terrible. There wasn't really anything I liked about it here.

Food - was okay, but the portion sizes are small and the price is quite high. The hamburgers are tiny and cost $9-$11 depending on the type you pick. I couldn't get over how small it was for $10 and it doesn't include fries! We shared 1 burger (between two people) one fries, one onion rings and 2 pops and the bill was $35 with tax and tip! 

The fries sucked too, looked exactly like McDonalds fries and the portion was small. Onion rings aren't really onion rings, they are those crispy deep fried onions but they were delicious.

The decor\/ambiance here leaves much to be desired. I"m honestly not sure what kind of look they are going for but the signage is green and white and tries to have a sports bar theme, and the restaurant layout doesn't seem to make any sense.

The service was okay, a bit slow, but not terrible.

Would definitely not come back here simply for the cost.

Terrible, keep walking.
Ordered the bunless fish burger and received a burnt fish stick, reminiscent of a captain highliner product, on warm rusty lettuce with tartar sauce as a "dressing"
Onion rings were onion strings, clearly reheated in a microwave. On of my kids ordered Mac and cheese which was at best soupy. All for a ridiculous price.
Looks like a great place to work. Staff blasting music and enjoying socializing, ignoring customers.
Keep walking, you'll find something better and cheaper.

Just attempted to eat a double. 5 lb burger at Whalburgers and to my horror i received a burger with two patties the size of a quarter.  Sent entire meal back. I suggest you buy a burger at McDonald's to see what a 1\/4 lb of meet looks like. Don't even waste your time eating here. No stars for this pathetic establishment.

When we got to Wahlburgers, the place was packed, no seats available.
The hostess was polite and friendly and we were advised by text how long the wait would be and when our table was ready.
The wait wasn't too long, about 11 minutes.
The burger wasn't the biggest, but it was very flavourful and served quickly.
I LOVED the poutine, and trust me, I know poutine.
My gf had the tater tots and she devoured them, so they must have been good.
Service wasn't the best, but what can you expect at a burger joint.
I'll definitely be back again.

My boyfriend and I were excited to check out Wahlburgers hoping to find another great burger joint near home.  We ordered the bbq bacon burger and the double decker w\/bacon  along with 2 sides, tater tots & onion rings for take out. We anticipated the wait, took 30 minutes, and was hopefull it would have been worth it. When we brought the food home we were disappointed to find out our order was wrong....no bacon on the double decker. The burgers were decent but definately had better but the sides were good.  I'm not sure if i would go back to wait 30 minutes and to have them screw up my order.   Btw, don't drive there....took 25 min to find parking.

We are on the hunt for the BEST BURGER in Toronto! Stop #6: Wahlburgers

Sometime in 2014 Mark, Donnie, and Paul Wahlburger expanded their burger shop exploit into Toronto. I have to say, I was skeptical. It's easy to toss a celebrity name on something (Trump University) then make tall claims. But hey, my friends wanted to go, so we went.

When you enter the restaurant you realize that 1) this is more than your run-of-the-mill burger stop, and 2) Marky Mark put a fair bit of that Ted 2 money to use here. There are two floors, a full bar, flat screens lining the walls, and some pretty nice decor. Think of it like a gourmet burger restaurant, where you can drink, and appreciate some shameless advertising of Mark's past theatrical works.

With an ever present skepticism, and on waitress recommendation, I ordered The Melt and a side of Sweet Potato Tots. First off, I'm not sure what kind of sweat shop they have in the kitchen, but damn do they bring out your order quickly. Now at this point I'm going to have to restrain my desire to use expletives to explain how in LOVE I am with these mother****ing sweet potato tots. You know that you've discovered something precious when on first bite you can't contain audible excitement. Like HOLY S***.
Anyway, after collecting myself I started on The Melt. On first glance, this looks like a fancy grilled cheese. Between their in-house made thick-cut bread is a beef patty, grilled government cheese, pickles, caramelized onions, bacon, and mustard sauce. What you get first is that beautifully buttered and toasted thick-cut bread. Then you proceed to dive into a cheesy and beefy comfort, that is reliably supported with bacon, and (somehow) more notably the caramelized onions. A really satisfying burger.

After all that, I was so happy with myself that I got Thanksgiving Day burger as well. Think of a turkey burger with the classic Thanksgiving Day toppings. And yes, that includes cranberry sauce. (Very good, but not the best they have.)

In conclusion, I have no problem admitting when I'm wrong. Wahlburger serves up some stellar burgers, a cool atmosphere, and the most God-the-f***-damn intoxicating tater tots you'll ever have. So how does Wahlburger rank on the burger hunt? It's coming out at a strong #2, tied with Holy Chuck, and right behind Toma.

Service was great--- sat at the bar-bartender was pleasant\/friendly and helpful. Food arrived timely. Cocktails were delicious. Our burgers were soo fresh and good and the special sauce is yummy!!! A fun vibe as soon as you walk in. Would recommend to anyone who is in Toronto and it's in a great location! Will def come back when I'm back in Toronto.

Pretty cool, but I was expecting more of a Shake Shack type experience. Didn't meet expectations because of the quality of meat and food in general: above average, but not stellar. And given all the hype, stellar was what I had come to expect.

Tried Wahlburgers today for the first time. Overall I think it was great. Tasty food, good atmosphere, prices are what I'd expect....mostly (see my comments on drink prices below). 

I ordered the Our Burger, Sweet Potato Tots, and Iced Tea. Total was $17 something.  Other reviewers have complained about the automatic 18% gratuity which did make me pause. But you can skip that and head to the back take out counter and order from there where no gratuity is added. They have a decent sized section of tables near the counter reserved for people who order from take out (same food menu).  So basically if you don't want table service just head to the back and you should have no problem grabbing a table after getting your food (no automatic gratuity). 

The burger was a bit smaller than other burger places (I ordered the single Our Burger not the double or triple) but with that and the sweet potato tots it was definitely a full meal. Burger was very tasty. Comes with lettuce, tomato, pickles, onion, cheese, and their special wahlsauce. I'd certainly order that again. You can add additional toppings for extra cost (think caramelized onions, sautéed mushrooms, crispy bacon, white cheddar, blue cheese, onion rings, avocado). 

Sweet potato tots were good.....probably a good complement to their Thanksgiving Burger.  The side order was quite large. 

My friend ordered the BBQ Bacon Burger with Tater Tots and Alma's Macaroni. She loved the meal.....raved about the burger! I tasted the macaroni salad and can say it was quite good...fresh tasting. 

On my next trip I plan to try the Wahlbrewski (locally brewed IPA.... I've read it's a special brew from Mill Street). It goes for $7 \/pint. Oddly their bottled beers seem over priced (bottle of Corona for $8?) I can only assume they're strategically priced to push the Wahlbrewski....

For a soft opening their staff was well prepared. Word is official grand opening is Nov 15 which may include an actual Wahlberg brother or two. 

I'll definitely return to try more of the burger menu.
Overpriced burgers, which don't come with sides unless you order them separately. Many of the burgers are very sloppy to eat as well.  It was empty when we went in - and for good reason.

Stopped by for a quick lunch. Had a club house turkey burger. It was pretty decent. Good enough for a quick lunch. Nice sporty vibe. The waiter was very accommodating too. Finished my food before taking a photo.
Very good Burgers the four of us agree but the onion were too greasy couldn't eat them all, and the prices were too high

Had to try Wahlburgers in town since I had seen the show many times. However the burgers are overpriced for the size and without any sides being included. The burger tasted fine, nothing extraordinary, and lacked any reason to come back. The service was subpar hostess was very nice but our waitress was not friendly nor attentive. The manager that was featured on the show, never asked us how our meal was as she was on her phone for a majority of our visit. I would not recommend visiting, just take a picture outside.

The food was great. When I went it was pretty dead. Which was nice because the service was good(sat at bar). Would for sure come back. Also had the blueberry pie frappetini, super delicious and fun concept. It's like a boozy milkshake martini.

heard about place for a while, was a little anti climatic

the burgers are dinky but good quality. got the turkey burger which was really good. could easily eat 2 of them. 

good to try out for first time but would prefer alot of other burger places. 

price is $$$ for what u get.

We had supper this evening at Wahlburgers ... it opened about a month ago.

As you come in the door, you are warned you may be videotaped or recorded.

There are lots of signs relating to Mark and Donnie Wahlberg.

We both ordered Our Burger and a side of fries.  The burger and fries were good.  The bun, while nice and soft, needs some work.  The top bun was hot while the bottom bun was cold.  Plus the top bun wasn't substantial enough.

As a head's up, they have dropped the automatic 18% gratuity ... now it's only on parties of six of more.

Asma took good care of us.

If I was in that area and wanted a burger, I'd stop in again.

If you want overpriced burgers, have I got the place for you!  This was such a disappointment, I had the veggie burger on a lettuce wrap, everything fell apart and I ended up eating it with utensils because it wasn't in any shape to be a handheld meal.  I can't believe I paid $12 bucks and waited 20 minutes in the takeout line for the privilege of having goop drip all over me.  It should have been served in a cup at that point.

I really had higher expectations for this place but was let down.  The burger patty was dry and quite tasteless. Fries were alright and probably better than the burger itself.  I won't be coming back here, at least not this location.
Wahlburgers is fine for a fast food burger; but it's nothing special. If you're really in search of an amazing burger, however, there are infinitely better places to go in the city.
Ok. $30 for two burgers and a small tater tots. Decent burger if you're in the area, but you can get way better for way less elsewhere.
It's better to just go to mcdonalds and save $. The Burger is decent at best and price is ridiculous high.

I always like to address the positive first: Last night (sat not busy at all) The burgers were absolutely amazing.  however, here is why the 3 star rating --the wait staff were extremely slow to busy talking to other staff instead of serving customers .  We were sitted within 5 min,  it took the wait staff 20 minutes to ask us if we wanted anything to drink or if we were ready to order?  For a fast food Burger place it took an additional 40 min to get our burger. The burgers were amazing (thanksgiving day burger) the tots and fries not so much. The establishment is very small, the price is very expensive.  Two burgers two fries and two soft drinks 44.00 Cad. Fries are charged extra. Would I go back yes.. But take out less the fries, wait staff need to be spoken too

Wahlburgers was alright, but the menu was a bit of a mess. They have burgers at 8 ounces and burgers at 1\/3 of a pound. Why on earth can't they stick to one measurement unit? Worse than that, their 1\/3 lb burger actually comes in two different patty sizes at two different price points. It's listed on the menu as a 1\/3 lb and suddenly you get a choice of how big it is. What? I was so confused by the waitress I just pointed at the menu. 

And it's creepy that they call American cheese, "government" cheese. Calling it government cheese makes it sound like it's going to be full of mold, maybe old and rancid, and kind of disgusting. Like it's been stuck in some government warehouse since the 1950s.

Burger was okay, nothing fantastic. Onion rings however, we're out of this world. Thin and lightly battered, with sea salt. Absolutely delicious.

With so many burger places to choose from, I doubt I'll be back. I'm not buying into the brand - I don't buy into any burger brand. I just want good burgers.

Kept passing by this place and I was intrigued as it's always packed. It's both a sit down and take out burger joint with a bar as well. We opted for the latter because it was already late; there are places to sit on the second level (by the washrooms). I was boring and ordered the original burger (forgot its name) with tater tots and a soft drink. For what I was paying, the portion was quite small. Burger joints in the city are a dime a dozen so I'll be okay checking out another business for my burger craving.

Good for: burgers, drinks

Pretty good, fun and novel but wildly overpriced. 
It's an American style gimmick reminiscent of hotel lobbies in the south.
It's unfortunate because i think the Chef Wahlberg is probably pretty talented but it's overshadowed by overpriced meh food and kitch. Not to mention, there are so many dope burger joints in the area.
This is a tourist spot that will likely attract the hotel guests, but I don't see any locals making this their go to.

Wahlburger finally comes to Toronto, it's been open for awhile. Even though the place is pretty close to me, I haven't tried it until tonight. Based on the reviews, it's been a mix of hits and misses, some likes it, some hates it. We decided to do the take-out instead of the restaurant part which was in the front of the restaurant. The take-out was at the back and they have seating at the back and some upstairs. You can avoid to pay the automatic 18% gratuity!

They have a variety of selection of burgers to chose from. I decided to try the Thanksgiving Day burger as it is the first time I have heard of it so it's worth trying. It is like having Thanksgiving leftovers on a bun with ground turkey, stuffing, orange cranberry sauce, roasted butternut squash & mayonaise. I actually like it, it wasn't as greasy compared to other beef burgers. And it went great with the stuffing and squash. The burger was unique, worth trying! The burgers are smaller compared to the other gourmet burgers, I was hungry after a few hours compared to others where I would be stuff for the night. We got some sides as well, the onion rings were really good. Not your usually one big ring but its shredded onions with seasoning and battered then fried.

The wait, even for take out was pretty long. As they serve in the same kitchen so they are cooking for the restaurant and take out. So if you are tight for time, you might have to leave some buffer time. We waited for about 20 minutes for the food.

Too bad, we did not see Mark!

Not the greatest burger. Personally I think it's overhyped since it's Marky Mark's chain. Definitely had better burgers elsewhere. The bun to meat ratio is too big of a range (bun is too big) and my burger was served cold. Service was great with tons of good looking bartenders. Pretty much a good spot for eye candy not quite a good joint for burgers.

As a foodie I was looking forward to having a good meal at Wahlburgers especially after all the hype it gets on the tv show. Instead I had a horrible experience starting with my server who didn't know anything about the menu and then gave me an attitude when I ask if I can alter my order as I am allergic to certain foods. 

Then I had the chicken sandwich and it was horrible.

If you are looking for something good and fast to eat, cross the street to Gretzky.

Got the regular burger with fries . My boyfriend got the bbq bacon burger with avocado. He liked the avocado with the burger. It was a decent burger but I didn't like that they buttered the bun and made it all greasy. Despite the butter, i found the bun and burger dry for a gourmet burger shop. Overall it was ok but wouldn't go out of my way to come back. It felt more like a fad with all of the posters and videos featuring mark Wahlberg. Without his name, I doubt a lot of people will visit or return. Burger priest is still my fave!

There were 4 of us for a "Sweet 16" aka 60th. The food was - well let's say my sister is from NJ and all 4 of us thought these were the best burgers. We had "the melt" it was incredible. The staff is lovely. It was packed and they treated us like we were their favourite table. It seemed they treat all tables like that. They also sang happy bday to me with a candle in the most delicious dark ice cream. Walburgers MUST come to Ottawa.

Don't come here expecting a sit down fancy atmosphere. It's a casual, standard burger joint. They have nice booths set up as well as counter space. Drinks are expensive for a diner setting but bw two people 16 each for a bottle is ok. I really like how you can order from kids menue which is waAY cheaper for exact same food just smaller sizes w out the sass. They are very into the fact that the Wahlburg fam owns the resto. They constantly play a video of the fam which is very sweet. The guy who was helping us was very chill and open to answering qs and make great convo. I loves there side dishes, shout out to the sweet tater tots for no extra charge., love it! Slider wize, not the best burger I've had, but 5 dollars for all appy hit the spot! And the burger was quite juicy, just with the increased burger joint trend going on in the city there's a lot of competition so you gotta bring your  A game. I will go back here more for the novelty but would chooSe another burger place for quality if I had the choice.

The fries were nice but the burger patty was small and I had to find it in between the buns. Cute, but not what a carnivore seeks. A quick bite, yes. 

The setup is slightly confusing in that the takeout is in the back of the restaurant. 

Didn't click until I saw all the references to Mark Wahlberg to realize the wordplay with the restaurant name.

This review is for their fast food meal route (towards the back of the restaurant). So here's the thing - we came here around 9:40 PM on a Wednesday evening right after a Blue Jays game over the summer (it's about a 5 minute walk from the Rogers Centre, and also within walking distance from the entertainment district). The place wasn't busy, there was no lineup (yet), and our stomachs were begging for sustenance. Because they weren't busy, we received our order right away, piping hot, crispy, and fresh (I ordered onion rings ($3.50) and their Signature 'Our Burger' (around $9.50)). We grabbed a clean table and actually really enjoyed our meal. 

The verdict? Pretty good! It isn't the best burger I've ever had, but it wasn't terrible either. I can understand the bad reviews below - our visit time occurred during off-peak, weeknight hours, where they could potentially put more effort into making our food. Regardless, the burger was hot and fresh, and the onion rings were super unique and different from anything we've had before - super, extremely thin, very crispy, and seasoned quite well (think of Hickory Sticks as onion rings, and that's pretty much what it is).

Prices were average to high for a gourmet burger joint. I paid around $17.00 for my burger and onion rings (no drink).

My boyfriend and I came in for a couple drinks and apps before seeing a Second City Comedy Show. Our server was sweet, and our food came very fast...no complaints there, but the food was very mediocre and the menu was way too pricey for what you get. Food is served in disposable containers. Honestly i would compare it to an experience I would expect if McDonalds began offering a sit down service- but at a higher price tag. Nothing really truly horrible, but I probably won't be back.
Bland bland patty, crumbly bun , stale fries for about 20$ including a drink and tax and tip . Run don't walk away from this place . SMH .

Extremely overpriced for average tasting food. Fries were soggy and the burgers are not anything I can't make at home. The seating area is nice and kid friendly. I wouldn't go there again as there are other sports bars and burger places in the same area that are better.

With all that star-power hype surrounding the Wahlberg name the expectations for Wahlburgers are set quite high. The overall quality of the food was good (but not great) and the people are friendly but as far as burgers go, there are quite a few other places that are better including Burgers Priest and Burger Works.

The space is divided into 3 areas; a bar, a full service area and a self service area. The bar seems to be the best compromise of actually being in the main part of the restaurant without having to wait for table service. The self service area is fine with tables and a few booths as well as some upstairs seating (which is small and secluded, near the washrooms). Also, small note, but dirty washrooms are really a thing of the past (or should be) for any restaurant that wants to get repeat customers. Get that _____ cleaned up!
