The downtown location is close to the Rogers Dome and the expectation of huge crowds from Jays games and other events was probably a major factor in deciding the location. The entrance is located right across from Wayne Gretzky's and that's the easiest way to find it. There's a lot of construction next door so it might be easy to miss.

We had a BBQ Burger and a Double Stack, the poutine and Alma's chicken sandwich. The BBQ is a 5 oz patty which is "smallish" but well put together and juicy. The double stack features two 3 oz patties that when stacked on top of each other make it very messy to eat and you'll be left with no meat and lots of toppings. The fries used in the poutine are a bit small and don't seem to be hand cut. The best item we had, ironically enough, was the chicken sandwich.

All of our items seemed to have a bit too much "special sauce". And as for the price, yes it is a bit high but maybe that comes with a glimmer of hope that you might see a celebrity. We paid $32 for the BBQ Burger, Double Stack, Poutine and 2 drinks. Add to that $15 to park in the area and for less than 50 bucks, we get to say "we ate at Wahlburgers" and looked at a poster for Ted 2. I can't see this being a quickly expanding chain.

This place has a lively atmosphere with friendly staff\/quick service, and good food... it's pricey for such a small burger (& no fries incld.), however. It's the sort of place people generally go for the experience (celeb\/t.v. show connection...), in my opinion, and ours was enjoyable.

Went with friends who all wanted to go. Worst burger I've ever had. The sauce, how the meat was over cooked and the tots were saturated in grease. I got the sweet potato tots and just one bite oozed grease. The staff looks great, the menu does not. Pass!

Great location, everything else sucks about this franchise. The pricing is high, even for the area. Let's not forget that by eating here you're also supporting Mark Wahlberg who violently attacked a Vietnamese man in a race related assault.

The standard burger, "our burger" is one of the best burgers I've ever eaten; the wahlsauce is to die for!
I've gone on two occasions and both times I've had mediocre service, not terrible but nothing that stands out as amazing. The caesar salad is a little bland, and I'm not a fan of the garlic salt on the fries, but the actual burger made it worth it for me.
I'm eager to go back and try the tater tots, as well as the sweet tater tots.

Went to Walburger for a new experience. Was in the mood for a good burger. Nice place, decor In green. Full bar. Lots of tables and tv screens. Nice ambience. Close to the entertainment district. Unfortunately the burger fell short of what I expected. I had to send it back as it was not warm. The onion rings were greasy and the fries where good. I got a new burger it was better. Management was nice and did not charge me for my fries. 
Would I go back? Not worth the drive from  Richmond Hill. Maybe if they added more burgers to their menu and I was in the area I may give them a second try.

After seeing the show and visiting the city for a ball game we decided to check the place out. We were told an hour wait, but gladly it was only 30 or so minutes, glad we didn't venture to far. 

I ordered the BBQ bacon burger and sweet potato tots and was moderately happy with my meal. The meal itself was pretty good (by no means the best burger I have ever had) but it was pretty tasty. For $10.50 for JUST the burger and $4.50 for the tater tots I am not impressed. My burger was no where near worth that much, was expecting a larger meal for $15. 

The place is pretty busy, but I was happy we gave it a try. I don't think I will be returning anytime soon, as there are many other places in the area to try. 

If you are looking for a place for a burger and side, and don't mind paying for an average meal, it's worth it.

The place is good and I went their with my family in the after noon
We ordered onion rings and some fries
They turned out to be fine 
So I would say so far so good

I watched the show for the first season and when I heard they were opening a location in Toronto I really wanted to check it out. The food tasted good but the portions are small and it is over priced. 

Also why do they have play walburger previews always playing.

Tasty burgers with yummy crispy homemade onion rings! I got a burger with a fried egg, pea meal bacon, and "government cheese" and loved it! Service was great too. Our waitress was super friendly and helpful.

What's saltier than the tears of a fan that saw their favourite team lose? Nothing much, except maybe the nachos here. Salt is fine, but their tortilla chips tasted like they were bathed in salt water. 

Food aside, the servers are awesome. It's a nice place to watch sporting events, they've got multiple screens that usually broadcast multiple games. 

I've never seen this place to be particularly busy, so if you're looking to find a place to watch a sporting event without having to wait for a table, this place is a decent option. Maybe just stick to the drinks though.

Great place to have a nice burger. Menu was simply but great. You can wait for a table or just head to the back for take out and there's a place to eat upstairs. I had the "Our Burger" 5 oz burger done their way. Loved the bun and the beef was so tasty. Got a side of Yukon fries, tater tots and sweet potato to share. We also shared the three mini burgers from the entree. For dessert I went with their classic chocolate milk shake. Although they don't have a terrace they have the whole side open so it's great in the summer. Service was great.

Best burger in Toronto? Indeed 1 of the best for sure. Excellent quality and amazing taste. Highly recommended! We ordered the "Our Burger" with sweet potato tots and golden tots. The service was great and the atmosphere was very welcoming. The food was incredibly delicious. I thoroughly enjoyed everything. I recommend this place for all burger lovers.

This place is terrible!!! Spent $38 (!!) for takeout for their Dorchester burger (dry and without any of the tomato jam advertised), crappy fries, frappe cookie shake and a salad that was so salty (?!) that I had to throw it away. Garbage. Go to A&W for 1\/4 the price and a better burger. Anyone who likes this place has got to have their taste buds (and wallet) checked.
This would never happen in Boston. Put cameras up Donny. Garbage over flowing. And I watched the bartender lick his fingers before putting my swizzle stick In my drying.

Went here when we were in Toronto for the guns and roses concert. We went for lunch on the Sunday after.

Place was busy and we were seated pretty fast. I didn't realize at first that combos didn't exist at this restaurant until reading reviews.  No big. It was my first time so the experience was worth the inconvenience of having to pay a la carte.  I ordered the OFD burger and the crispy thin onion rings.  Really they should be called onion strings....  No resemblance to an onion RING what so ever.  The wife got a "entree size Ceasar salad" and tater tots. 

Staff was friendly and prompt,  which was surprising to me when I think of Toronto... 

The burger was good. Not visually appealing with the bun squished and mangled,  but non the less the flavor was great. The onion strings were a tad Greasy and no real batter to them.  Gf loved the tater tots but we both agree the Ceasar lacked in both flavor and croutons (3) dressing was water and very little to no real Ceasar dressing taste 

We had our experience at wahlburgers,  I can't personally say I'd go back... Maybe as a last resort on Bluejay way. It's between a 2 and a 3. I would give it a 2.5 but that's not an option so I'll be generous and give wahlburgers a 3

Was weary because of the low ratings, but was literally around the corner from Soho Metropolitan. Close by, and open late until midnight. 

Busier and nosier mix of tables\/booths closer to the bar, doors open so you can get fresh air while you eat, but still technically indoors. Closer to the register are more booths and tables that are usually empty and therefore more quiet. Some large TVs there as well -- tonight happened to have a reel of Donny and Mark Wahlburg, and some of their family. 

We did takeout a couple times, and service was always so fast. Both nights we waited 10 minutes. Plenty of condiments, utensils, napkins to help yourself to. Beats having to ask someone to give you adequate amounts of those things. Guy manning the register was friendly when taking our order and patient when I got confused with their current menu versus the online one

Most of the food was really good :

Our Burger- This comes with Wahl sauce? Not sure what that is, but all I saw was melted cheese. There was no other discernible taste of said sauce. It suited me because I like a basic standard burger without any fancy dressings or sauces to gussy it up.This was a great burger, always hit the spot. Patty not too thin, not too thick, and was the proper ratio with the toppings\/bun. It's not a large burger\/patty, definitely not the size of a diner or Chili's burger.

Hot dog- Couldn't really mess this up. They gave the tiniest ramekin of sauerkraut. 

Grilled cheese with tomato and bacon - lots of cheese, gooey, and buttery bite. Had chopped up bacon pieces rather than strips inside. 

Chicken fingers - Doubt these were made in house, but three very large flat strips of chicken without thick breading so it was mostly chicken and thus very filling. 

Crispy haddock sandwich - crispy as stated, not soggy or greasy, but barely any flavor because they were either too stingy with the sauce or the sauce had no actual flavor. Hard to tell because there was so little of it. 

Tator tots - Always crispy on the outside. Perfect crunch, but then soft inside. 
Yukon Gold fries -- day to day, the size of the fries varied. Once they were thinner, the next day fatter, but wider. The latter seemed fresher and crisper, whereas the previous batch was darker, as if they used old oil. 

Have a small selection of cupcakes by the register. Honestly, one of the best cupcakes I've ever had and they only had one chocolate left the first night. Chocolate frosting was buttery and rich yet light and whipped in texture. Super moist cake. I wasn't able to get it again after since they seem to buy more vanilla based flavors and in small numbers, like 3 per flavor.

Order:

  - Double Decker (Cheese and Lettuce)
  - Yukon Gold Fries

Price:

I found this to be quite an expensive meal given the portion for the meal I purchased.  The Yukon Gold Fries I felt were a fair deal however the burger seemed to small to be worth the $10.95 price tag (and that's without bacon).

Size:

I found the size of the Yukon Gold Fries were satisfying however the burger was much too small for my liking.  Everyone has their preferences but if you have a similar appetite, this burger will leave you feeling hungry once finished as it did for me.

Quality:

The quality is something to boast about and somewhat over compensates for the stiff price.  The burger was very juice and you could taste the freshness of the patties based solely on the fact that it melts in your mouth as you chew down. The fries had a certain "zing" to it that I found delicious compared to your typical fast food restaurant.

Overall:

I would most likely return to this restaurant.  Despite the steep prices, the burger was actually presented well and the taste complimented it nicely.  Perhaps next time for a bigger burger to satisfy my large appetite!

Such a tasty Thanksgiving Burger!!  However we were waiting for over an hour, the music is too loud, the staff are snotty and the looping videos of the Wahlberg boys yukking it up is lame to the point of nausea.

Very, very meh.

We had the BBQ Bacon Burger which I thought was okay - nice heat from the jalapeno, slight bacon flavour, creaminess of the avocado. They indicate they cook all their burgers to medium. This burger was more like medium well.
We also had the OFD Burger - this was VERY medium rare, I felt uncomfortable eating it but couldn't do anything about it because we did take out. Had I been dining in the restaurant, I would have sent it back to be cooked more. The dominant flavour was the tomato jam - the mushrooms, bacon and swiss cheese were all lost. 
We had the yukon gold fries (tasted like frozen fries, pretty soggy) and the sweet potato tater tots (obviously made from frozen, but they were tasty.)
$33 for all that (no drinks!) - I will take that money somewhere else that uses quality ingredients and knows how to cook a burger.

I went to Wahlburger's on a Friday during what I believe would be dinner rush time and received fabulous service. The hostess was welcoming and the bartender (who was my server) was very accommodating and friendly. The "our burger" was hands down one of the best burgers I have had! 
This place is a must try!!!!

actually 2 1\/2 stars. Stopped in for a burger with a few buddies.The burger was good, the poutine was bad. The waitress was clueless. 
Overall just okay.
We would not return.

This is a solid burger joint when you are craving a classic greasy burger. Stick with the OFD\/Our Burgers and skip whatever seasonal or proprietary concoction they're trying to pass off as a burger. Laughable to call it a gourmet burger house as I consider the bymark burger to be barely acceptable and Wahlburger's obviously isn't even remotely in the same league. Hit up Marben or nota bene if you are looking for a real, well-rounded gourmet burger. 

Service - Disinterested and curt counter servers. Take out orders take 15-25 minutes to render (even if you're the only one in line). Shuffle to the side after you order and watch whatever sporting event they are streaming and cheer for the sports ball game. 

Tater tots - hit and miss with their crispiness, often times soggy, laden with grease
Fries - not too greasy, pretty decent, but ask them to go easy on the salt unless you like licking salt blocks and relish next day salt bloat
Onion rings - skip these, comes out a soggy mess 4 out of 5 times

OFD burger - can barely discern the swiss cheese, all their buns are cheap white buns with zero redeeming features, no premium fluffy artisanal sesame studded stuff to be found here. Subsequently they get soggy real fast and falls apart while eating (their housemade tomato jam is super jammy), fat, juicy and greasy patty (8 oz. might look paltry in the box but that thing is a killer), will leave you uncomfortably full afterwards but man those first 2-3 bites are just so darn satisfying
Our burger - just a consistently satisfying burger, again the cheese is barely discernible, the pickles are too thin, the bun is a mushy disgrace but if you are low on iron, this thing will get you right back to where you need to be
BBQ Bacon burger - the jalepeno packs some heat and makes this burger a lot more interesting then it actually is, their choice of bacon doesn't add much to the flavor or texture of the burger, BBQ sauce is awkward and cheap tasting, skip it
Thanksgiving burger - a confused concept but basically tastes exactly as it sounds. Order it if you want a leaner cut of meat (the stuffing is quite good quite) but be prepared to feel strangely empty as you eat this grey-ish and sullen-looking patty and ask yourself how someone's tastebuds could be so immature and misguided that they would be compelled to tack this on as a "Wahlfave

So the first time i eat here i got just a cheese burger as i normally  dont care for these "designer burgers" and the bill came to 19.00 for a burger and taters ,  drink
Which they said the tater where famous lol tasted like macain frozen  tater to me. The cheese burger was meh so i said I would never go back for a 20 dollar burger that was meh. Then a friend at work told me to try the thanksgiving day burger. A well seasoned turkey sandwiched between STUFFING and MASHED SWEET PATATOES AND CRANBERRY JELLY  amazing also again almost 20 bucks but worth every bite . But due to price of a regular  cheese burger  i will only come back for the "Thanksgiving day"  if you are going to eat here you better have deep pockets like a movie star

Read Yelp Reviews. Went in to check it out. 
ITS DELIIIIICOUS! !! I Loved it! Will come back again. I had: OurBurger and Fries.

We went fairly late in the night, after a long day in the city. The staff were super friendly, we didn't have to wait at all to be greeted and shown where to go order for take out. The girls behind the take out counter were really awesome in helping us make our decision. We had to wait a little for our food, but considering it is made fresh, the wait really wasn't that long. The quality of the food is awesomez fresh, hot and exactly how we asked for it. The fries were delicious and also stayed hot on our walk back to our hotel. 
I went in because of the show, but I will absolutely be returning because of the fantastic staff and delicious food.
I would highly recommend giving it a try.

I really don't understand all the hypes regarding this burger joint as everything here is a la carte and there's no combo meals, you have to order individual meals separately.  There are 2 levels of this restaurant, upstairs where it's self service, and if you are very lazy and don't want to serve yourself, you can sit downstairs and have someone serve you and enjoy the street view.  For me, I don't mind helping myself and watch everything from upstairs.

This location is located near the Metro Toronto Convention Centre and is within walking distance from all downtown attractions.  Very easy and safe to get to from anywhere.  I'm not really impressed with the food here but I can finally cross this place off my list.

Extremely slow service with mediocre food. Food did not live up to the hype. From the show, it appears that they have a lot of pride behind the food that is served. What we received didn't do their name justice. Burgers were just ok and gravy used for poutine came straight out of a jar. The salty dark brown stuff. Gross. The only reason they have 2 stars is because they had the beer I liked on tap...

Wasn't impressed with this burger 

Obviously had a lot of hype behind it, but definitely did not live up to the expectations IMO 
 
It's a decent burger, I would have given maybe 3 stars but its a 1 because the price was way off, should be at least a couple dollars cheaper. You're better off going with either Burger Priest or Holy Chuck if you're paying that money

When I got here and we were sat down, our server mentioned 18% gratuity would be charged to us immediately for our group.  Welcome to Wahlburgers can I take your order!  To be honest if you want to try this place I suggest going upstairs to the pick up\/take out area where you can order a burger fast food style and sit down and eat it with unlimited pop to boot.  It's basically the same service as you would get in the restaurant, without the annoying TV monitors blinding you and your server telling you, you've been charged 18% gratuity, without even seeing the menu yet.

I ordered the Thanksgiving Turkey Burger with the sweet potato tater tots.  I was expecting a lot based off my friends recommendations and the TV show they have, but boy was I underwhelmed.  My burger was dry and tasted like it was previously frozen.  I could not even tell it was turkey to be honest and there was barely any stuffing or cranberry on it.  The tater tots were also pretty average and tasted like something straight out of a package of McCain fries.

Needless to say, I probably won't be coming back here unless I'm desperate for a burger or my friends drag me out here again.  Look elsewhere if you want quality fast food hamburgers like South Street.  Heck, even Harvey's is better than this place and about 1\/4 the price!

Meh

I mean it was a burger. That's it. I hate it when things get hyped up cuz then I'm waiting for my mind to get blown. It was a tasty burger don't get me wrong just nothing special also was sort of cold ish.. 

The sweet potato tots or whatever were actually kinda weird. 

I actually like the interiors the green pops out well a bit much gloss on the chairs but works

I loved this place and it was better than I expected. Let me state right now that I'm a fan of the show and I love the Wahlburg brothers. I'm still a New Kids fan and I loved Mark Mark when he front lines the Funky Bunch. I'm also a Boston Red Sox fan so I had to check this out. I went with my mom before the Jays\/Red Sox game on 30\/08\/17 because we both were curious. And I'm glad we went. The staff were friendly and we were seated promptly as well as order drinks quickly. When we asked for recommendations, our waiter was more then happy to help. I chose to have their special The Smokin Burger with Sweet Potato Tots for a side. My ordered The Melt. We just went with gingerale and coke for drinks. Nothing  fancy there. Maybe because I had no expectations I thought the food was so good. I could just barely finish my burger. It was juicy and topped with yummy condiments - the hot sauce was spicy but not so much that it was unbearable; the caramelized onions added a sweetness to the burger, and the peameal was added a smoky flavour that I didn't find annoying (normally I dislike peameam bacon...yeah, I know). And the tots? Holy crap they were delicioius. Honestly, I could've just had those. Unfortunately, I can't speak for The Melt although it looked just as yummy. I took away a star because we had to wait when it got busy. Which I feel like they should be used to because it was game day and that whole area gets busy. Other than that, it was great. So try it if you haven't already!

Got their signature burger and it was meh. Bun was interesting and the sweet potato tots were a nice change from regular fries. It was soooo salty though - definitely have had better burgers for the same price.

Stopped here last night before catching a Jays game. There were a lot of people waiting so we anticipated a long wait, but in 15 minutes we were seated. 

The host staff and the wait staff were incredibly friendly and caring and made us feel welcome despite the hectic nature of that evening. Once we ordered our food we waited practically no time and everything came out exactly as we'd ordered and it was absolutely delicious. 

Our server was sweet and we mentioned to her how pleased we were with the food and the service and she was so glad because she said she'd felt like she was drowning, but she handled it so well that we had no idea. 

Overall this was an excellent experience and the food and drinks (white sangria) were fantastic. Definitely would make another trip back here!

Let me start off by saying that we have been waiting for this place to open for months so you can imagine my excitement when I heard it was finally open. Now onto my experience. 

The food was mediocre at best. I ordered the "Our Burger" it was ok but it was just that, it was ok....nothing special. Along with my burger I tried the sweet potato tater tots, terrible idea. They were over salted, soggy, and just not appetizing. 

My boyfriend ordered the bbq burger and hated it. It was extremely small and extremely overcooked. He had the regular French fries and they were again just ok , nothing spectacular. 

My opinion like other reviewers, go to Burgers Priest and save a few dollars and get a better meal.

My boyfriend and I went here on a Friday night after work. The food was good, we got two different burgers that were both quite good and different from each other, but the drinks were certainly overpriced (though there own brand of beer wasn't bad) and the automatic 18% automatic gratuity was a little annoying. Thankfully our server was nice enough to tell us it was added in already so we didn't tip her twice. If you go, be prepared to spend a little extra than you might be comfortable with for a burger.

Had the double burger,  tater tots and a frappe.   Bun for the burger was great but the burger patty size was a joke.   Toppings were fresh,  tater tots are just McCain hash brown bites from any supermarket.

Ok, first it a burger joint. All you foodies, lighten up. Thank up Wahlberg's for returning the affordable yet delicious burger back to the dt area. For too long Torontonians have been taking it in the pocket book for some good quick eats. Then when a place comes along that does it better and cheaper, they bitch. 

So... my experience at Wahlburger's was exceptional. Maybe I wasn't comig in from all the hype, maybe I wasn't expecting a celebrity sighting, but rather just a decent burger. Actually that's what I got. 

My burger was the Thanksgiving Dinner, truly tasty would be an understatement. It is pretty much what it sounds like turkey, stuffing, cranberry, gravy all wrapped up tidily onto a bun. I followed up with a Mudpie "adult" frap shake. Made with an oreo cookie base and a wee bit of adult content. That's over 19 here in Canada, for the Americans reading this. 

My servers name was Kim, I highly suggest sitting in her section. She was on top of her game, and like every  great American  restaurant I have ever been to, she had refills of my water before my glass was ever empty. 

In summary, blah blah blah... great burgers, blah blah... great service, blah deblah good prices. I will definitely be going back.

We thought that based on the show the service would be great and the burgers good... Service was not what one would expect and the 18% gratuity for poor service is a joke!  We were 5 adults and one child so this was a group of six and told ofthe mandatory gratuity.  If you have this fee then service your clients to prove the tip is worth it!!

Burgers were good however, A bit greasy...
Long ticket time!
Menus were in very poor shape considering it recently opened... You don't see this mess on the show!!!  Go to the Toronto location... You will all agree!

Meh. Came here for a quick bite with the hubby while running errands and pretty sure I won't be coming back. It definitely has that "American tourist" appeal (I can say that because I'm American) where there's a celebrity name slapped on to a restaurant with mediocre food. 

I had the BBQ burger which wasn't too bad. It had a LOT of different flavours on it but for some reason I couldn't taste any of them except for the jalapeño. 

My husband had the double decker which, you'd think would be two patties on one burger.  But no...they just took the meat from one party and split it into two tiny patties that don't stack very well once toppings are added. Although his burger constantly falling apart did brought me humour.

Ultimately it's a fast food joint that added servers in order to up-charge and create an 'experience' (and with the staff all being in very short skirts and of barely legal age, I'd say it was an experience that left me feeling dirty).

I really didn't know what to expect...normally these kind of places that have a celebrity's name attached to it is merely a cash grab....not at Wahlburgers! The burger is literally one of the best I've ever had. Ingredients were fresh and the burger was hearty and very tasty. The fries that I ordered were fresh ,crispy and delicious.
The establishment was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely be returning.

Meh, this place is just okay. Honestly I did enjoy their burgers and their fries and I'm a huge burger fry guy but for the price that you're has to pay there really isn't much to this place it's basically a McDonald's with Mark Wahlberg photos hanging over the walls. There's also a dining room area where you can have a waiter serve you these McDonald's like burgers. Which to be honest just seems really weird. 
I'm not sure if while burgers is a burger joint or a restaurant it has fast food quality food and fast food atmosphere with waiters, a bar, and price from a expensive restaurant.
The Thanksgiving burgers pretty good and deafly worth a try but I wouldn't think to go here on my own accord. Though somebody else were to mention going here I would have a problem with it.

I went in at about 10 at night. I had low expectations based on the reviews I had read. There were a few tables occupied. I wasn't there for the ambiance, it would never match the TV show, I was after takeout. 

I ordered the "Our Burger" figuring that if that's the one Paul likes it's the way he intended it to be. Ordered some tater tots and some onion rings. Almost $20 later and about 5 minutes for my food to come up, I headed back to my hotel. 

When I got there I was pleasantly surprised. The burger was really good. The meat was moist, the paddy was thick, and all the toppings could be tasted. It was well put together. . The tater tots were tater tots. A little less greasy than the ones from my childhood with crunch and a nice taste. The onion rings were a disappointment. They are onion threads, something that you would recognise as a topping for a steak. The flavour was okay, but one bite was enough. 

Would I go back, sure, the burger is good and I enjoyed it. Next time I am in Boston I will make the pilgrimage to the original.

Just meh. Marketing gimmick more than a restaurant. 

Disappointed that the food wasn't more spectacular or the menu more creative given what a great chef Paul is supposed to be. Thought we'd get a little taste of Boston, home to university crowds and sports fans, and that they would be going on a great menu instead of just the Wahlburg name. The TVs all had their show playing so it was like an ad campaign for the show and their brand. 

We had the Our Burger and the BBQ Bacon Burger which were good, but nothing special. Appreciated the smaller portion sizes, but not everyone will. Hugely disappointed in the Caesar salad which (was forgotten in the order) arrived plain Jane with all romain hearts, no leaves, dressing from a jar, powdered Parmesan cheese, no lemon, something you might find in Swiss Chalet or Olive Garden. White vinegar and yellow mustard - it doesn't get much more American than this folks. 

Oh, and people were lined up against the wall waiting for empty tables that weren't set. And it was just before high-noon on a Sunday so it wasn't like they had just been slammed. Staff holding conversations right in front of tables which isn't comfortable when seated. 

$56 (before tip) for two burgers, a Caesar salad, one order fries, one beer and one 6oz glass of wine ($12) - definitely not worth it. Better burgers at Heros and food and menu at any of the Firkins. Sorry boys, we probably won't be back.

Had the double decker and a Wahlbrewski. This burger hit the spot! Plenty of people eager to hate on a celebrity owned tourist spot, based on seeing other reviews. The service was great and eager to assist and clear any trash from the table. Very reasonable priced

Stopped by for lunch with coworkers. Out of our 3 orders, 2 of them were done wrong. We arrived before the lunchtime rush but we still waited 15-20 minutes for our burgers. Once the burgers were made, it took an extra 5 minutes for the servers\/cook staff to determine which burger was which. We had to watch them poke around our burgers with a pen to try and determine what toppings were on it. Afterwards, one of the burgers had an egg on it, which we hadn't asked for but because of the long wait time, we just took our order as is. Once we started eating, another burger had the wrong toppings on it.

Quite a shame as I was really hoping this place would be good. I think with better organization and staff training, they could stand a chance but with the way things are now, I feel like it would be rare for people to make a second visit.

WE wanted burgers and shakes so we popped in and sat at the bar. Never heard of this chain and no, never watched the show. but don't fret, one of the flatscreens plays wahlberg only material, his bio, his career, his music, his restaurants. So if you don't know the wahlbergs, after 30min, i promise, you will. Oshee was our irish bartender and makes a mean milkshake, nice and thick. The sweet water blood orange beer on tap was refreshing and light! Had 2 pints. 
I ordered a burger with avocado, arrived rather quickly but I could not get over how SMALL the burgers were and GREASY. But we were hungry so we ate our small, greasy designer burgers and the milkshake filled us up. decent experience, we came back again for shakes which was interesting because, in the middle of the afternoon, they had a security guard at the door. They say its for sports fans who tend to fight during game season
.....frrigin bluejays!

I ordered the BBQ burger, a double decker, whatever they claimed was their version of onion rings that just looked like scraps, sweet potato tots, and a strawberry shake for $40. 

I found the food here to be WAY overpriced and the buns were unusually greasy. 

I actually found this place to be an almost equivalent of chipotle in NY, meaning the super longggggg lines just to place an order for food. Smh...

Even though I'm visiting Toronto, I don't see myself trying to eat here again before I leave for NY. 

Unlike when I found Sonic and made my way over there about 3 or 4 times.

After months of waiting finally got to try the famous Wahlburgers..... unfortunately that will probably be my last visit.  I ordered the double stack our burger which was stated to be 1\/2 lb,  which was at most a quarter pound with both patties combined. ..  I also ordered a side of sweet potato tater tots which came freezing cold and salted to the point they couldn't be eaten. .

After reading some of the disappointing reviews I decided it was time to test out Wahlburgers for myself. I would like to encourage more people to do the same as the reviews tend to be a bit over exaggerated in my opinion. 

The location of Wahlburgers is fantastic, it is right in the heart of Toronto. The set up inside Wahlburgers tries to be an innovative approach by being able to order cafeteria style or be seated and waited on. The staff is extremely rude and unorganized however the food itself is to die for. The burgers were perfectly cooked and the fries and tater tots were extremely additive. I will be back.

Food - 8\/10 
Service - 2\/10
Atmosphere - 7\/10 (although I really do not like the whole green everything layout)

Fiancee doesn't like Mark Wahlburg, so I may get in trouble for having eaten here, but the rest of my coworkers wanted to try it. 

We were on our way to a Blue Jays game, so we decided to get the 'to-go\/self-serve" burgers, i.e. we ordered in the back, got our food and took it to the tables they had set up upstairs. We were all a bit shocked by the price of the food. The burgers were quite pricey for what they were and they didn't even include a side. 

I ordered a kids cheese burger with all the toppings and a side of sweet potato tots. I have to say that it was honestly filling for me, but for how much the boys paid vs what they got, quite underwhelming. $10+ for just the burger and then extra for fries... 

In terms of the actual food, it was tasty, the burger was cooked well and the tots were nice and crispy, yet squishy on the inside... the way tots are made to be. 

There was tons of Wahlberg things on the wall and the top 10 movie clips or something playing above the bar. 

Not bad, but definitely a touristy place.

This place was good, but extremely overpriced. I was expecting more of a "sit down" restaurant but this was more along the lines of a fast food joint. Food was good, but very expensive for what you get and the type of restaurant that it is.
Dropped by shortly after opening. Burger was good... tater tots and thinly sliced onion rings were great. They forgot my request for jalapeños. At the price point it doesn't feel like great value.

Had one of the best burgers in my life at this place. 8oz beef bacon burger sauteed with mushrooms was perfect right till the last bite. I had to slow down when I realized I only had 2-3 bites left and remind myself to savour it haha. The poutine was also a good side and perfect size.

Oh boy. Me b de suker.
Where do I start: hamburger is not special or tasty. Indeed it is small and fatty. It oozes oil. Oh no.
My friend had told me about their turkey burger but I guess it is removed from the menu since.
Price is high (I mean that), portion is small and taste is nada.
bye bye bye Wahlburgers bye bye byyyye

I was craving a solid burger tonight. Despite the reviews, I took a chance because it's right around the corner and always packed. I sat at the bar because I was flying solo and the bar tender is probably the best looking man I've seen in Toronto so far (I'm from California). I ordered a beer, the BBQ Burger and sweet potato tots. It was freaking delicious!!! I was missing home and craving In-N-Out but this hit the spot. Finally, something above average in more ways than one!

This place is indeed Mark Wahlberg themed. His pictures and quotes cover the walls. 

Wahlburgers seating is divided into 2 sections, full service (at the front) and self service (at the back). I was initially pretty confused at the choice. Why would someone choose self serve if you can be served by someone else? Ended up realized that the difference is savings in not having to tip.

On to the food! 

The eh?!? burger was alright. It had peameal bacon, a nice juicy beef patty, and a runny egg. It was gigantic and tasted great but granted runny eggs is probably not the best idea in a burger. The meal got real messy real quick. 

Fries were meh, overly salty for my taste

Would not recommend the banana fluffanutta dessert. It can be easily made at home in under 5 mins with bread, pb, Nutella and bananas. Not worth the $5.

All in all, mediocre food in a Wahlberg centric environment. Personally not a huge fan of Mark so I didn't appreciate as much.

The place was nicer than I expected. I was expecting a fast food experience but this place has a nice bar, waitresses etc.

I sat in the bar as I just wanted to grab a quick bite. It took forever to place the drink and food order. The place was busy. I ordered a triple decker, which is supposed to have "over 2\/3lbs" of meat. Well, I got a burger with 3 tiny patties stacked on top of each other. Did not look like over 2\/3lbs to me. The buns were tiny.

I figured it was going to be enough food anyways so I didn't mind too much. I started eating the burger and realized that this was one of the most boring and flavourless burgers I've ever had. It wasn't bad per se, but it really was so blah that I have no plans to go back. It really wasn't any better than a $3 McDonalds burger. I was expecting more from a $12+ burger (fries not included)

Arrived mid-way through lunch, got a table with some friends. Enjoyed a tasty burger and some sides. The service was great. I enjoyed my sweet potato tater tots and my friends had onion rings. The onion rings are more like something I would put on a burger instead of a side. Tasty food, clean space and great service = excellent lunch.

Had the OFD burger here last weekend with a side of tater tots. It was the greasiest thing I've had in awhile.... Just between greasy and delicious with it finally going down towards too greasy.

Had to walk for awhile and drink rums and cokes before the mess finally settled in my stomach.

As another vegetarian reviewer said: not a lot to choose from.  I agree, is it so hard to have a simple garden burger patty on the menu?  Lots of places do it, but maybe that's more of a Californian thing.

I didn't actually go in but I walked passed it every day and man it's loud.  They blast their TV noise on the street.  I do not need to know what you are watching, nor do I want to!

My dad went down to get us some fries when our delivery was taking forever and came back with fries, tots, and onion rings.

First off SKIP THE ONION RINGS.  They were ok for the first 2 bites but they are literally just nothing.  They are not big and crispy.  They're what you put on burgers if you want crispy onions.  They should not sell these as onion rings.  Also, they smelled bad afterwards and the smell lingered for 2 days.  Made me feel queasy.

French fries good.

Tator tots not good either!  Sad.  It is not hard to mess up a spud puppy, you guys, but it's basically like a mashed potato ball from here.

Skip skip skip.

Came here for the novelty, left still hungry. My friends and I ordered the Thanksgiving burger, portobello burger, regular whalburger, and crispy fish. We agreed that the food was pretty average but not $10\/burger worth.  

I ordered their tater tots $3.50 as my side, I would recommend them, they're actually quite fresh. We stuck with water which was continously replenished. They do serve local Amsterdam brewery blood orange radler which is exciting. 

The service was fast, friendly enough, table got cleared before we got our bills (good service? Or get out?). 

They were playing the Wahlberg reality show and as my friend cunningly put it: "I don't want to see Mark Wahlberg in a private jet while I'm eating a burger

Food was good but for the price u pay compared to portion size and quality of service, it's not worth it. I was excited about trying it but I probably won't go back unless someone I know wanted to go for the novelty of it all.

We were on our way to see a comedy show at Second City. Only came here because the show was starting in 30mins and we've never been there. I honestly have no idea how this place survives. The only thing that is keeping them above float is their location - because it's a high traffic area for Roger's centre and surrounding areas.They prey on poor chumps like me who are looking for something quick and easy. But their food takes long and its expensive for below average burgers. I ordered the sliders - came with mini thanksgiving burger, our burger, and bbq bacon burger. The thanksgiving burger decent - the rest were gross. Dont expect your burgers to come with fries either. The price is just for the burger itself - and if you want other toppings - that's extra as well. Nothing special about this place. Would not return or recommend to anyone. I would have been happier with a $3 street dog instead.

Was in town for the Jay's game Aug 9,2016 with my wife and 3 girls. After seeing the show and the enthusiasm Paul had for the restaurant and food quality the Toronto location was a HUGE disappointment. I knew pricing was going to be high \/ portion size small and might have to wait in line. Did the take out line and took the food upstairs. Restaurant as a whole was clean, larger garbage cans or openings the size of the tray's would be more user friendly, and the employees were pleasant. We made it before the dinner rush BUT;
the fries were cold, with no seasoning, not even salt
the chicken fingers were bland
the burgers were on the small side and I thought maybe Wayne Gretzky had slap shotted a few pucks across the street onto our plates they were so over done.
If you are headed for a game, eat at the venue, same price, more choice, better food.

Burger wasn't anything to write home about, it was dry and poorly put together. The nachos barely had any cheese on them and were cold when we received them. The service was good, our waitress was very polite and attentive, but the overall experience wasn't great and I don't believe I'll be going there again.

Went to the Toronto location before making the long drive back home. My buddy wanted to go and since we don't have any back home I was game. I did see the first episode of the show so it worked as an hour long commercial I guess.

The restaurant has an interesting setup. In the front (bar area) you have a typical sit down service restaurant, but in the back is an order counter where you can get your food "fast food" style. We sat at the bar where there was various sports on the multiple TVs in the area. Most had on Soccer and Baseball, while a few were dedicated to showing clips from the Wahlburgers TV show. Other than that there wasn't a ton of Wahlberg memorabilia. 

The food was good. Was it the best burger I've had? No, but it was still a pretty good burger. I got the melt which was on two slices of thick cut toast, "government cheese" as they called it (American), and onions. As usual, I held the onion. I was a little surprised the burger was not cooked to order, it was just a medium well. It was still juicy though. Also, the bread did not get soggy which is a major bonus (talking to you Burgatory). 

Our bartender was the star off the show though. He was really talkative in a good way. Conversed with us, made recommendations, and was just all around pleasant and fun. 

Would I go out of my way to eat here, no, but wouldn't turn it down if someone suggested it either. A solid 3 stars.

My friends insisted we stop by and eat lunch because they are huge fans of the show. The food wasn't bad, it was what it was; burgers and tater tots. My burger was properly cooked and seasoned, but didn't really seem to be anything special. tater tots are exactly as I remember them from my school cafeteria. I had a milkshake which is good, but again it's was a normal milkshake. The truffle cookies we're probably my favorite thing that I ate. We went to the back counter to order and I have to say the service was pretty rough. The woman that took our order got it wrong twice while typing it in, once she got it right it was about a 15 minute to 20 minute wait for our food. It may have just been who took our order because other customers seemed to be getting out much quicker. My biggest issue is this was glorified fast food that cost just over 40 bucks for two people. I wouldn't go back purely based on the cost to quality ratio, but the food is exactly as you expect it to be make your decision of that I suppose.

Nice new addition to my building!  As the second to review, I'd say the first review was a clear case of "hating". Anyone having difficulty with an 18% tip probably should be dining at McDonalds.  I had their "Our Burger" and it was perfectly cooked, delicious taste.  Had fries on the side which are shoestring fries.  The fries and the onion rings which should be called onion strings do not come out looking like most people are used to.  However, the taste of both of them are quite good.

No question that the place is more expensive than your average burger joint, but is this really surprising?  You are going to pay $15-20 for a combo at the Priest or 5 guys as well.  In terms of the burgers, The Priest is still better but the feel and decor of Wahlburgers is far and above the competition.  I'd recommend getting the sample sliders so you can sample the different burgers.  Definitely would go back!

My friend and I quite enjoyed our burgers, the Our Burger and BBQ burger were both delicious, well seasoned and appropriately topped.  The bun is exceptional and melts with the burger.  Our opinion was the burger was perfectly sized and of a decent  value.   

I wasn't a huge fan of the thinly sliced onion rings but they were tasty.  Maybe the rings need a do-over with thicker rings  but the portion size is generous.

The gluten free truffle cookie was served warm and a  perfect dose of chocolate. 

It's too bad that the place is getting some negative reviews ... If you read them most agree it's a tasty burger ... Isn't that a good thing.   It's worth a trip.  I will definitely go back.

The decor screams fast food joint. I  was surprised when I was seated with a server

The burgers are overpriced and they don't come with a side. 

The tater tots are the McCains...Frozen tater tots. Seriously. 

Also. don't tell me how much I should tip.
This place has good food but is extremely overpriced for the portion sizes. If the burgers came with fries then that would make up for the expensive burgers. However, the service was really good.

Burgers were dry, not juicy at all.  Love tater tots, so no complaint there.  Their "Onion Rings" are not onion rings at all but onion straws that you see garished often on steaks so definitely not I was expecting and not good as a side.  Agree with people commenting on the decor, it's definitely a weird fusion of sit down and fast food.  Bright white and green decor screams freshii, not a gourmet burger joint.  Bar looks good, lots of selection but again, fits in weirdly with the rest of the decor.

Actually a 2.5.

Decided to try this location as per a friend's recommendation based on what he heard.

The dining area is clean and well kept, very welcoming. The food however was a huge disappointment. In my opinion, it was overpriced and you get very small portions. I got the triple burger (the largest thing on the menu) and it was still tiny! I was still hungry after eating it. The quality of the food and taste was good, but I won't be back here because I don't believe the value for money makes sense at this chain.

Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to a friend - I would tell them to go somewhere like Hero Burger or Five Guys instead.

What a colossus disappointment, giving 1 star is being extremely generous!!. If you are looking for burgers and double burgers disguised as sliders, you will love it. As we open our meal and noticed this terrible burger, we called the manager and asked if by someway we received someone's else's kids order. She was no help ,,.,,.,,,,,,,don't want to ramble here but the Walburg  family should be ashamed of themselves serving this garbage....... My advice is if you want to enjoy a good burger, just go somewhere else, anywhere that serves a burger is better then this garbage .

Pros:
 Decent burger
Good fry portion
Lots of seating


Cons:
 Burger was pretty small
Fries were below average
Not worth the price at all.
Sitting in the quick eat section tip is added to bill.

Cost me $22 for a double stack burger, fries and coke.

Twice I have been to the restaurant.  The first time I ordered Jenny's chicken burger and the second time I ordered the portobello mushroom burger.  Both times I was very pleased with not only the food but the service.  I can't wait to go back!

Seasoned ground turkey, cranberry orange sauce, mayo, mashed butternut squash and turkey dressing on a bun. Called the Thanksgiving Dinner. Just saying, it is good! 

Took one point off for venue\/layout - is it a sports bar, diner, or fast food takeout?

Me and my husband came to whalburgers
After the autoshow and we were starving. The service was let's say...mediocre and the wait for take out was verrrry long (maybe because of hunger?) we ordered two double deckers,two fries,onion rings, Alma's Mac and one drink as they don't do combos. Well that all came to.....$44.52! Very expensive, however we really enjoyed the burgers. the fries were ok and the onion straws or strings? Well those are ok too. It's definitely not worth going out of your way for but still is pretty good!

I didn't know what to expect given all the bad reviews but I had a good experience and very likely to return again. 

I thought the "Thanksgiving" burger was really good. A large thick juicy turkey patty with a layer of turkey stuffing, followed by a layer of mashed sweet potato and topped with cranberry sauce. Very unique and delicious.

I had the side macaroni salad which was OK but a little plain. I will try the tater tots next time, they looked good. 

I sat at the bar where the service was good and my food arrived within 10 minutes. 

They have a decent beer selection on tap - Wellington Stout, Beau's Lug Tread, A nightmare on Elm Street, Mill Str. Organic, steam whistle and a house IPA (unfortunately sold out on my visit).

I found the restaurant kind of loud - so many conversations and Prince playing loudly from the audio system (Yuck). 

Many reviews complained about the high prices but I thought the pricing was normal for downtown -  $10 for a burger is the new norm. Sides from $2 - $5 and beer at $7.

BK

I was with Dante R. On November 14, 2015. I wanted to add. That NO I would never go back, in fact, the best part of my experience was leaving. I swear people facing the electric chair get better customer service than we received. We could of gone to one of my favourate pubs and gotten better service and better food and at a cheaper price. People of Toronto if your looking for a place to eat, skip this place!

I'm a fan of the TV show, Wahlburgers, so I was looking forward to trying the food here but I have to say I was disappointed.

I ordered the O. F. D. (Originally from Dorcester) burger and the Onion Strings. First of all, it took almost 15 minutes to prepare my order, with only two people ahead of me. Although the burger tasted good, it wasn't even hot enough to melt the cheese. The Onion Rings (strings) were very enjoyable. They had a nice crispy texture.

Overall, nice place, slow service, decent tasting food, but I've had better, much better, for less money.

3.5\/5

Came here after a jays game and I must say the service was extremely good here and the food was not bad but kind of on the pricey side.

One thing I'll start off with is the fries are kinda like Mcdonald's fries but not as flavourful. I had the poutine and it was good but not enough gravy. Would be nice if fries came with the burger but it's extra.

Tried the Eh! Burger and it was really good, the peamel bacon and sunny side egg on the burger went really well together. Maybe the only thing I would change is less mustard flavour in the sauce. Overall it was a good burger. 

Also had a vanilla frappe milkshake and it was solid.

First - what I liked - the burger itself. I got their basic Wahlburger, and it tasted like something that you would have on your back porch at a good bbq party. I liked it. And yes, it was $9 - but that's what you're going to pay for a burger in downtown Toronto.

I also liked the multitude of sports screen options, and plenty of tables to sit at. The hostess was very nice and sat me promptly.

What wasn't so great - I get that it's Wahlburgers - but do we have to see a loop of everything Mark and Danny Wahlberg have done their whole lives? It plays on the screen 24\/7 - and it more makes you realize this guys have been in more duds than actual hits. Don't get me wrong - I like Mark W. (was never really an NKOTB fan - nothing against Danny), but I don't need this.

I think people are going to find the prices too high, and the fad of it may wear off quickly, but I would probably eat there again in a pinch. Let's face, Gretzky's across the street isn't known for having reasonably priced fare, and that's been there forever.

I really love watching the show and after I decided to visit Toronto I decided to make my way to Wahlburgers. First of all there is no public parking in the area. I had to pay $20 just to park to car to have a burger. Went inside and decided to do self service because the other side was full. There were an abundance of flies hovering over the food which is disgusting. Food isnt as good as they hyped it up to be. I can get better burgers elsewhere and definitely not worth going out of my way for.

Been here for over an hour, still don't have food. We asked to order and frankly literally waved our hands for a while before we were even served.  A table that came in after we ordered just received their food. We asked about it and we were told our order likely never processed. Would have been nice to know that when they found out...offering us 25% discount.  Not enough for the horrible service.  Pains me to say this as I love this place and their food but this isn't acceptable.

Don't get me wrong, Wahlburgers have tasty burgers, but they were costly and miniscule. For that price, I predicted their burgers to be two inches thick and stuffed with cheese. That would be ideal if I didn't go in with high expectations.

You would think I order a burger called the melt with cheese and it would be on a nice burger bun. Instead it's a patty on stale toast and it just sucks. What a let down. Was looking forward to going here to have a burger for a week! A comment from the waitress that's it's not technically a burger would have helped.

Such an amazing burger and the tots are a must try. We also tried the skinny onion crisps, but those you can pass on.
The Wahlburgers beer was a nice touch and a pint of it fits perfectly with any burger!
Good food. However, it's extremely overpriced for what you're getting and the service albeit friendly is just too slow.

Tried this place tonight thinking it's probably decent and that previous reviewers got it wrong. Not so. 

The burger I got was a double BBQ bacon burger.  

The good:
Let me say that the flavours were pretty damn good! Good mix of jalapeño, avocado & sauce
Fries were good. Takeout service was friendly.

The bad: 
It was tiny! I was starving so I got a double thinking it would fill me up. Not so. These are not than much bigger than a slider in diameter at least. Fries & burger $17+-

Needless to say I won't be back. What could have been!!

I am very surprised by the sub par review of this burger joint! I for one really enjoyed the burgers here! Though it quickly becomes obvious that Wahlburgers charges a premium on their menu items for being a celeb-owned resto. As pricey as it may be for a modest-sized burger, I would still recommend it. 

I went for the 'Eh' burger, which is a protein powerhouse, comprising of: a fried egg, beef pattie, and peameal bacon. I teamed it with the sweet potato tots, which I must say, was an excellent combo (counteracting the savoury with the sweet). Not to mention, sweet potato tots were priced the same as the fries and onion rings, which is unusual but nice!

The regular burger (5 oz) is stacked tall but modest in diameter and circumference. If I can compare it to anything, it would be a large slider. But don't let that discourge you, the content of the burger is made to perfection, albeit very messy to eat. If you are a big eater, you may want to upsize the burger to 8 oz. The tots surpassed my expectations and then some. They were crispy on the outside with a perfect sweet center. This is a must-try for all sweet potato enthusiasts out there.

Came here last night because my man and I had heard mixed reviews about Wahlburgers and wanted to try it for ourselves. Also, I've had a thing for Mark Wahlburg since my childhood, but don't tell my man that! 

The place is a lot bigger than we expected, with a seated table-service area in the front and take out in the back and upstairs. We liked the decor; it's perfect for the area with the Skydome (or Rogers Centre, whatever) nearby because it has a more upscale sports bar vibe. Good for groups and kids too! 

As for the food - I ordered the Thanksgiving burger (their turkey option) and regular tots, while my boyfriend ordered the BBQ Bacon burger with the sweet potato tots. We both really enjoyed our food. I will admit that the burgers do look a little small when you receive them (especially if you order the 5 oz. like I did), but these burgers are more about height than width and are definitely filling. The portions of tots are quite large, I had to get my boyfriend to help me out with mine. I will say that my tots were too salty and I kind of wished I ordered the sweet potato ones, as they were definitely more flavourful, but that's my own fault. I was also disappointed that there was no sparkling water and I was served tonic water instead. Yuck.

A burger and a side comes in just under $15, which is pretty standard for fancier burger places in Toronto. Not sure why so many people are complaining about the price when most are quick to shell out $12 for McDonald's and their mystery ingredients without a complaint...

Will be back.

Really unimpressive fare.  I had the double decker with lettuce, tomato, pickles and Wahl sauce.  The patties were okay, frozen is my guess, but the bun just really stands out as the worst part of the experience - it was too large and the bottom was stale.  I had the 'crispy onion rings' as a side, which sounds great, however it's just a large bowl of frizzled onions - the kind The Keg serves with their steaks, only these are much less cooked and would make a better topping than a heaping bowl of lightly fried onion side dish. The decor is reminiscent of a Sobeys.   They actually sell 'Wahl Gear' in their gift shop.  You could find a better meal anywhere in the city.

Was not impressed at all. Over $25 for a 8oz BBQ Beef burger, fries, pop with tip and tax. Burger was NOTHING special. Found it tasteless. Fries ok, to much salt. Service was lacking. Never even asked how the burger was. I would not go back. Yet I was excited to try the ones in Vegas. Think I will pass on the whole chain. Also it says on the menu that the burgers come medium. My burger was well done and dry. I know you can not serve a burger in the GTA medium, the need to change the menu.

I had been looking forward to a good burger, and I guess I bought into the hype, so I headed to Wahlburger's on my lunch break. Not such a great decision. I sat at the bar, where I was ignored by three indifferent bartenders for well over 5 minutes even though they weren't busy. The bar seats approx. 12 -15 people I guess, and there weren't more than 7 people seated at it, including me so I'm not sure why I had to wave the guy over in order to get a beer. 

Anyway, I ordered the "Our Burger" (which is supposedly what they built their rep on) and a side of onion rings. When my meal arrived, the burger itself looked great. The onion rings, on the other hand, did not. The menu describes the onion rings as "crispy fried bermuda onion sliced thin, tossed in sea salt & parsley", which apparently means a large bowl of onion strings - the type that belong as a burger topping, and which no one in their right mind would consider or attempt to eat as a side order.

As I said, the burger looked great, but looks were deceiving. A shiny, brioche-style bun was strangely hard, and the burger patty was dry and had the consistency of one that was previously frozen. The toppings were good. That's the best I can say about that. 

Service from the bartender didn't improve either. No one checked to see how my meal was, and it was up to me to motion them over so I could get a fork for the mouthful of onion straws that I ate (definitely not finger food) and later to get a refill on my beer. By the way, props for them at least offering a decent selection of draft instead of the usual macro brewed crap. 

Two beers, a very mediocre burger and a side of onion straws: $33.00.

Just ate here with this afternoon at the Soho location.  

PROS:
This is a very good central Downtown Toronto location, can't beat the spot on Blue Jays Way.
Decent service noted considering the typical busy lunch period on a Saturday and especially for a long weekend.  Waited approx. 10 minutes for my order so not bad. 
Main level seating area was fairly clean.  

CONS: 
I tried the OFD burger for myself and can honestly say that I have had much better.  I also understand the higher price for the central downtown \/ hotel location but this burger was bland (meat had no seasoning at all) and also way to much oil overall, which turned the potential brioche-style bun into a soggy disaster.  The tomato jam was more like regular tomato sauce, quite disappointing.  My friend tried The Melt, also way to much oil and wrong choice of bread used in my opinion (regular white toast), which crumbled apart because of all the wet ingredients - could have been better with a thicker bun. So $30.00 for 2 burgers and one drink, was not worth it at all.  
Decided to sit at the upper level since the main level was quite full, big mistake (should have taken our food to go) because the tables were not wiped down, lots of napkins and garbage on the floor & messy condiment area.........some fast food joints out there do a much better job with the cleanliness and upkeep.  Although the upper level is a more casual seating area, it should not be overlooked.

I'm rating this place 2 stars based on the quality of food vs overall price, and the lack of cleanliness.   There are better burger places in the city that are worth the price.

Walburgers - nothing to rave about.  Like a few have commented "Not terrible but it's not great".  I got the BBQ Bacon Burger  $10 - Burger itself was pretty small and the patty was dry on my burger.  With all the burgers places in Toronto I will not be coming back.  The price itself was on par with Priest burger which blows this place out of space.  You get what I am saying.

Huge disappointment.

I had company in town and they are fans of the tv show, so when I mentioned that there's a Wahlburgers in Toronto, we had to do the drive into town to check it out. 
We arrived on a Saturday afternoon at 2pm..the place was packed. We were told by the very friendly hostess that the wait time was substantial (as there were 8 of us), but we were free to order ourselves and dine upstairs. This is the option we took.
I ordered 2 BBQ Bacon Chessebugers, 1 Tater Tots, 1 fry, 2 pops....bill came to $36.05. Seriously...$36.05.

So....it's very similar to 5 guys...you order your meal and then wait for your order. Time from ordering to the meal coming out was just over 20 minutes.  While waiting, 1 customer brought his burger back complaining it was cold. The girl behind the counter asked what was cold, the meat or the bun. He burst out laughing and said "all of it". She then asked the question again.....? WTH? It took over 10 minutes for a "warm burger" to come up. The girl working the counter kept reminding the kitchen to rush his order...and a kitchen staff member yelled back (and we could all hear it) that she'd get it "when he was ready to give it to her" and that he "couldn't cook the meat any faster". While this was going on, another customer brought her order back as it was incorrect (they didn't give her what she ordered). She had to wait at least 10 minutes to get a replacement. The manager was apologetic to both individuals and did offer free fries to both of them as compensation for the error. 

Anyways...on to our order.

The burger itself was very dry, which is odd because the burger meat is moist. The meat itself is tasty...and although it looks small, it is filling. The jalapeños (there were 3 of them) were very mild, the cheese (white government cheese) melted off the top and surrounded the burger, the bacon..el cheapo.....it was 1 thin strip (couldn't even taste it)..overall, the burger was a huge let down. Fries were on the cool side...definitely not hot. Tater tots reminded me of the ones you get at Burger King for breakfast...Yikes. 

Overall, a huge disappointment. 

Won't be back.

We had friends with us (a family of 6...2 adults, 4 children)  They ordered 2 melts, fries, onion rings, 3 smahlburgers.....5 pops. Bill came to just over $60. They were shell shocked and the kids did not like the burgers at all. She also said the onion rings were odd...they're not standard fare...very little breading and she said they were pretty flavourless. Both adults said they were disappointment with the meal and that they won't go back, even if in the area.

I guess the novelty of the owners is the draw...it may be enough to get people in the doors...it won't keep them coming back. 

Free refill on pops,.....

So I am a huge New Kids fan and was super excited to drive the hour up from Buffalo, NY to go to this in Toronto. We walk in, there are three very young teenage girls just standing by the hostess stand. I look at them and say, we have two can we get a table. "Oh sit anywhere." Okay that's the first mistake because now they are not evenly placing people to the waiters' tables, and now the waiter has no idea that we are his table. After ten minutes of just sitting at the table, we ask a hostess if we could get our order taken and she finds us a waiter; who again probably did not know we were his table. After about 35 minutes our burgers and tots arrive; why such a long wait, it wasn't packed in there. Every so often I would look around at the staff, two bartenders? On a Thursday? They looked bored out of their minds. Why three hostesses? And they would all stand together and just talk, about six or seven of the staff would just stand around and do nothing but chat. Where's the management? Also, the girls' uniforms? Seriously? If the skirts were one inch shorter I could tell if they had bikini waxes, as a woman, I am disgusted. So the food arrives, my bf orders his medium rare. His is over well done; sends it back. Within two minutes he has a replacement, again over well done. Finally, what appears to be the manager comes over and explains that in Canada the meat needs to be cooked a certain way and has to be frozen first. The burgers were gross. I had lumpy things in mine and kept having to spit it up. Also, the menu lists the cheese as "government cheese." What the hell is this? Are we welfare recipients? I want Swiss or Chedder on my burger, not government cheese. Is this only like this in Canada, is the Boston Wahlburgers different? So the Manager at least comps by bf's burger, now he is starving after having been in this establishment for almost an hour. The regular tater tots were too salty for me to eat and the sweet potato ones tasted funny, maybe it was the oil they used. I don't know, it was just a very disappointing meal and still cost over $20 even with the comp'd burger. Never again will I go here. Terrible service and terrible food.

I have to do this review based on my experience and less so on the experience of those I went with. We came here before a Blue Jays game, the place was packed and loud but they do have a good system for alerting you via text when your table is available. We waited about 20 minutes which wasn't too bad. It took quite a while before anyone came to take our order but it was busy so it is understandable. There are two levels, what appeared to be a takeout counter and TV screens, good for sports fans. 
The reason why I will not be coming back here and why I cannot give them anything more then a 'meh' 2 rating is because they claim to have something for everyone, but I ended up having to eat an order of sweet potato tots as a dinner. Their 'veggie burger' option was a mushroom which had more mushrooms on it as a topping, please note Wahlburgers, not every vegetarian likes or wants to eat mushrooms with more mushrooms. The salads were super limited and the caesar had anchovies in it so I couldn't have that. 
They seriously need to rethink their veggie friendly options, because they're awful. I've been to lots of burger joints and wing places heck steak houses even have better options for vegetarians then this. Vegan's forget it, not happening for your here at all.

Great looking restaurant. Of course one has to go just because of the name and story. Yes the service was good and the food was good. . . BUT! Sooooooo not worth $20 for a burger, fries and drink. 
Far too many other better options in Toronto for much less.

The food really isn't anything special, but the service was excellent. Our server Bianca took care of our group of 9 throughout the night and we wanted for nothing.

Burgers are decent, the tots are great. Onion rings are tasty but if you're expecting the big hearty A&W kind you're S.O.L. They are more shoe-string style and go well as a garnish to a burger.

Beer is totally over priced so I'd not recommend this place for a long night of drinking (which we inadvertently did). 18% auto-grat for everyone if you dine in - not just for large parties - which is unusual so beware of that as well. But, as I said, Bianca was awesome so it was a well-earned tip.

EDIT: we came here because we had visitors who watch Wahlburgers and wanted to check it out. Be prepared for screens pushing Wahlberg related content.

Had a great experience with Holly at Wallburgers - we accidentally sat at the "sit down" section - not knowing the back part to order was only take out or take upstairs - instead of chasing us out or upstairs - she allowed us to stay where we sat - and took care we weren't bothered to move! We know now how it works - was not clear coming in as there was no hostess there to tell us - after walking all morning I really appreciated her kindness and understanding - we need more kind, thoughtful and friendly people like her in the World - never mind just in Wallburgers - you got a good one boys! Give her a promotion! Thanks Holly - if only I had more loonies and Toonies to give her!

Burger........it was ok but nothing special, not for ten bucks. The fries........a scrawny order made from frozen fries, came to the table luke warm. Three and a half bucks. Service...........fast, but it felt like they wanted me to eat and get out of there.

There are some way better burger joints in this city, and some of them even have fresh cut fries. I'll keep going back to my regular burger stop.

The food is good, but the portion sizes and prices make it a difficult place to want to re-visit.  I had the chicken burger, which was juicy and spilling over with toppings.  Their buns are tasty, but too small for the burgers.

The deep fried tater tots were also quite good.  Really, how can a deep fried tater tot be bad?

My total for the burger and tots was $16 and change, with tip $20.  I'm also a pretty small person and I left hungry.

The restaurant is rather large and in a pricey, touristy area so I understand the pricing.  Unfortunately it means this will probably just be a tourist hang out.

I was not impressed with the burger or service. Burger was very small for the price, was dry and lacked flavor. The server did not refill drinks and we had to wait for her to get up from her break to pay the bill.  This was a once in a lifetime experience for me.

Short and sweet. Burgers were alright, beer selection was good. Sweet potato tots were meh. Quite pricey for what it is. I'd take a Big Smoke or Burgers Priest over this any day. Glad to have tried it once.

I live not too far, so I went last night with friends to give it a try. 

The decor is ok, but I am really not a fan of the green they put everywhere, I just don't think it goes well in a restaurant. 

You can either sit and get served or go order to the counter and sit wherever. 

The cashier was very patient and helpful when we were ordering. I was quite famished and she suggested a good size burger. I had the Our Burger (8oz) and fries. Burger was quite tasty and decent portion. The fries were OK but lacking a bit of flavor. 

My 2 friends both ordered The Melt and fries. They were both happy with it. 

Like other people mentioned before, even if we said we were dinning in, we got all our orders in boxes and disposable cups. What's the point to ask then? 

I might go back, but only for take out as I cannot say my experience in the dining room was so amazing.

I ordered the classic burger - I found it expensive at around $10.00 with no sides included.  It tasted quite bad - dry bread, greasy on the outside, dry burger and the special sauce was not tasty either.  Definitely not worth the money - I was also disappointed by the tiny portion size.  I cannot recommend this place - there are better burger joints around.

Decided to stop here because my daughter's a fan and I was in town for business. I first want to say that I thought my burger was delicious (the Dad one) and so was the poutine. Now for the bad news. I paid $18 for a burger and poutine with a child's drink. Not what I want to pay for lunch but for a one time stop, I'm OK with it. I have to say that although the burger was delicious, it was tiny! I'm a smaller woman so it was good for me but any guy would most likely have to get two, so there's that to consider. And there's just too much Mark stuff - geez!

I did get a chuckle as well as a lunch, compliments of the two ladies who were taking orders at the cash registers. I asked where I could wash my hands and they looked at each other and then at me and one said, "I guess over there" pointing to the server station with a tiny sink. "Do you not have a bathroom?" I asked. Then the lightbulbs went off and I was directed to the ladies room. Then I asked if they had wifi in the restaurant and again, looked at each other and then me and said, "I think so but it's probably only for employees". No light bulb this time, but I was amused and felt like I was in a Saturday Night Live skit!

I won't return, but I'll remember it!

There are two parts to this restaurant: Table service & walk up counter. We elected to go to the counter, got an OFD & Our Burger, an order of fries & an order of poutine. They brought out our food relatively quickly, and it was hot & delicious. No complaints with the food itself. Only complaint was the price. Nearly $40C for two burgers and sides?!? Dang, super expensive! I get it's Toronto, NYC of the North but holy buckets, idk if I'd do it again.

I ordered the "eh" Burger ($10.45) which has a 5oz. patty (I upgraded to 8oz!), peameal bacon, fried egg, smoked cheddar, lettuce and ketchup. I also added some wahl sauce. It was a messy burger but it was great. 

I also got the onion rings ($3.50). They were these thin, wispy onion pieces that were covered in batter, didn't really like them and probably wouldn't order them next time.

For seating, there were 2 floors. You can be seated in a portion of the first floor where you can be served or just order to-go\/dine-in at the back. 

Overall, the food was good but I think there are better food options in the area.

Quick summary. Food was average. Service was average. Nice atmosphere. 

The standard size burger "Our Burger," is really small. Dubbed the 5oz, it looks much smaller. Burger tasted great - just a small portion. Fries were nothing special. Seemed like standard Wendy's fries (even Wendy's may be better). And do not order the onion rings as a side. They aren't actually onion rings. It's a bowl of the shaved crispy onion pieces. Something that would go on a burger, not an actual side. He pricing is a bit much for this food. At the time of writing this, it's only be open for 2-3 months - not impressed. 

I won't be back. It's too bad. Had high expectations. I wanted to like it. They did have sub charging ports in the booth though.

For a specialty burger place this one kinda sucks. Overdone patty, lame cheese, pathetic fries (worse than McDonald's!), only decent service for a sit-down place, loud atmosphere. The only reason it wasn't a 1-star is because I only tried one thing and I admit other things might be better! Seems like a popular place so I might be missing something.

Was so excited to have a burger joint come into our area, instead of another pizza place. Went here and was so disappointing. Sat in the dining area and the burgers were ok, and the fries were served in the paper cups like in the take out stuff. Onion rings weren't even onion rings but like the stuff they put on your steak for garnish. Was shocked to see the 18% mandatory tip, where our server didn't do much but take our order, give us the food, and brought us waters (we don't drink alcohol). Only to find out we could of ordered the same food for the same price and sit up stairs in the fast food area for free and saved the 18% or even walked the block home. Never going back.

Not a bad place. Honestly, the food was pretty good. It's was a lot like a Sonic or Shake Shack. Definitely a fast food burger place.
