It was very busy when we went and I'm sure that it's usually like that. What is pretty cool is that you can either sit down and eat or go order yourself and take it out or find a place to sit (I think that's how it works?) The service wasn't the quickest, but everyone was friendly.

The choice of burgers were pretty typical. I had the BBQ Bacon Burger and the BBQ sauce was extremely good. The burger overall was decent. Sweet potatoe totes weren't too bad either.

I have to say that the TVs were extremely annoying. I don't dislike Mark Wahlburg, but every other TV played a reel about the Wahlburg family (basically that means there were some clips to Mark Wahlburg's movies). It started to get very annoying. I would have much rather that the just played his movie or something.

Overall, it was enjoyable, but I doubt I will return.

came here to grab a bite to eat with my girl from the states.. as per my request.

1) we waited at the front for a good while before we got dismissed to the back - we weren't asked if we were dining in or taking out... we wanted to sit and eat. we go to the back and get redirected to the front.

2) almost slipped and fell because the floors weren't clean... i was told to watch where i'm walking 

3) we ordered an alcoholic milkshake and we're asked not to see our ID's but rather "are you old enough for this?!" i'm sure i'm older than the server was.

4) ordered the mushroom burger only to have her walk away with a look of disgust.

5) we had to ask for the bill 4 times before it was brought over - the place was empty.

6) i'm not returning to this location.

I loved it! My burger was delicious, I had the BBQ bacon burger which was delicious! I had it with the tater tots and they were very good too! My friends had the Melt burger and the double decker and they were both very happy with their choice. One friend had the onion rings and granted, they are not the conventional type, but they were great!! I actually liked them more than the usual rings.

Service was good too. Our server was a friendly young lady. It was quick and she did make sure we liked our burgers and had all we needed. I'm certainly going back again!

So my friends and I decided to try out this place on the recommendation of a close friend of ours. we were in costume and appreciate that they allowed us in with them on. however. that was the extent of their good service. first of all. when my friend who clearly stated that he was diabetic and ordered his coffee and a diet coke. and you give him splenda for his coffee but regular coke? the hell? this is not "oh I'm drinking diet coke because I need to lose weight and i like the taste" no, this is, "I drink diet coke because if i have regular coke, I could possibly go into diabetic shock" next was the coffee we got, it was weak and tasteless. and not worth the 2.63 I spent on it. also they never asked if we wanted more coffee, my boyfriend was asked multiple times if he wanted another soft drink. so did my friend's fiancee, they both got refills on their drinks, so why can't we get another cup of coffee. next was the food, where to start, overpriced, not that good, and for the amount you get, I could go to a street meat guy and get twice the amount for less than what I spent on it. my boyfriend and my friends ordered a side of sweet potato bites and onion rings, which granted the onions were great, but they were not rings, more... strings of fried to a crisp. the sweet potato bites soso. to be honest they tasted like the same ones I could get at Loblawas for 10 dollars and get a nice big bag of them. when we got our food, the server, who's name was Allan. just gave the food to my other friends sitting on the other side of the table. so we assumed that their hamburgers had come with said sides, when we asked when we would be getting our food, Allan bluntly stated that "oh you got already, i see you have the empty cups" I am utterly shocked at the lack of service, training and lack of attention to detail they had there. in all honesty I could of gone to an A&W gotten better costumer service, better food, more food, faster service at less than half the price. it Disappointed!!!  It's a burger place and the burgers were just not good.  I believe it is related to poor cooking rather than poor quality.  Burger patty could've been used as a hockey puck.  Adult frappes were great.  Tater tots were just what you would expect.  Onion strings were not good.  The service here was exceptional.  Our server did a great job and was very attentive.  My fiancé says "I love you Donnie

Yelp seems to really give Wahlburgers a hard time. People need to realize that is not a fancy place. It's your typical burger joint but with a little bit more. I love the food the service is great and it's my favourite place to go after a game. Yelp people need to stick to there own fancy places and stop picking on others.

The other reviews are right. Not a very good place and for $10 a burger, there are many better options in the city. 

The burger was not juicy at all and rather boring. It felt like I was eating a burger king whopper and the BK whopper is better. Worker's also don't wear hair nets... Hard pass.

Upon entering, the hostess immediately informed us all diners in the front would be charged an 18% gratuity.  Welcome to Wahlburgers!  

Is this a sit down restaurant or a fast food joint?  Actually, it's kind of a mish mash of sports bar (several screens), eat-in restaurant (servers), fast food (order and your food will be put into a paper bag for take-out) but you can also eat your take-out food in the back where you won't be charged 18%?  Weird.  

This burger was A-OK.

I tried the bbq bacon burger.  The 5 oz. patty was a decent size.  The bread was nice and soft.  There was a bit of kick due to the jalapeños.  

If only the patty was juicier though.  

For $9.95, it's not completely out of the ballpark.

the burger was fine. Onion rings a bare pass. But there's no chance I'll be back. 
The place was almost empty. I think I know why
 On every wall, the middle screen is an endless loop of Wahlburgs being "entertaining". After 20 minutes, I wanted to puke. 
Make the burgers better and cancel the selfindulgent self promotion!

Terrible.

Small portions.  
Cold food.
Overcooked meat.  

I don't get this place at all.  I have no idea what theme they are going for.

My friend and I went to Wahlburgers the other night. She had already been and said it wasn't half bad.. even going on about how good the onion strings are. I went an ordered the Thanksgiving Burger.. sweet potato tots.. and a strawberry frappe. 

The service was friendly but slow. I was particularly creeped out by a guy who kept staring at me, which made me feel really uncomfortable while we waited for our food. When we got our food, we took it to go. Got home only to find the sweet potato tots pretty bland. They barely added any salt, and definitely NO SEASONING whatsoever. The "frappe" which is said to be made with ice cream, was very artificially flavoured. The one and ONLY THING I enjoyed was the burger. It was a decent size for me with very juicy ground turkey. The stuffing was amazing with a healthy dollop of squash. The touch of cranberry sauce was perfect at the end. 

With all honesty.. I will go back. But only for the thanksgiving burger!!

I came here because I love Mark and Donnie Wahlburg. I wasn't expecting it to be good as I've heard a lot of bad reviews but to my surprise I enjoyed it a lot. Who knew pairing taters with burgers would taste sooooo good!! I was in love immediately. I ordered the Our Burger which is Paul's favourite so it had to be good. The burger was cooked to perfection. Wasn't dry and really juicy. I'm talking bout dripping juice lol. Next time I come I would def try another burger and the sweet potato tots. I can't wait!! 

My husband and I came around 2 and it was still packed so expect a crowd so expect to wait a little or if u get lucky U can sit by the bar. The service is great super friendly. The store is crowded but surprisingly it's not messy.

I expected a lot more coming here due to the celebrity status and the fact that they have a tv show about the restaraunts. 

To start, we entered and one of the grills was broken so they were only able to seat 30 people so we were wait listed but asked to leave while we waited.

When our table was ready we were put at a 2 top squished in the corner, I kid you not... Squished. 

Our server was nice but not on top of things. We ordered and she didn't write it down properly I guess so she had to come back and ask twice what we ordered. My drink was also empty and she walked by multiple times and I had to stop her to order another drink. 

The food took a while and when It came it was barely warm- almost cold. The burger was kind of dry and lacked flavour (our burger) and my boyfriend had "the melt" which he was disappointed it was just a burger in between two peices of bread which were grilled. tater tots were awesome but they were cold when they came out. 

Overall, we wanted to see what the hype was about but won't be returning. Over priced for what it is. If you want a great burger joint- hit up holy chuck burgers at yonge and st. Clair !

I live very close to Wahlburgers and my review is based on going (1) when they first opened and it was really busy (2) recently on a Saturday to give it a second try. Both times, I was not super impressed with their burgers. 

Pros: 
- The staff is very nice and always friendly
- Tater Tots are not bad but you can always buy your own bag of McCains
- The services is relatively quick (you can be in and out in an hour)

Cons
- The burgers are very greasy (I know, burgers are not suppose to be super healthy, but doesn't mean the buns are gleaming with grease) 
- The burgers are put together very haphazardly. I had the original burger and turkey thanksgiving burger. Both times, I need a billion napkins, which they graciously give, to clean up the sauce that is oozing out the burger. I get the need to have sauce on a burger, but not to the point where it is coming out from all sides of the bun and making your bun soggy. 
- The burgers just don't match up to some of the great burger joints in Toronto like Burger Priests, Parts and Labour or even franchises like Milestones or Jack Astors. 
- The wait times to get a spot. I got it when they first opened, but as I seen in the reviews below, no matter what time or day, even if the restaurant is not at full capacity, you will have to wait while their staff cleans the tables. It seems they have a very inefficient way of running things, they don't have a bus boy\/girl cleaning up the mess. The hostess is often running around spraying tables, cleaning up messes and setting up tables. Often, you see a table where the servers have clearly used as a dumping ground for unclean glasses.  This turns me off, but what really sets a bad taste in my mouth when there are CLEAN TABLES AVAILABLE FOR SEATING, but your servers are slow in setting the table!  So, Mark, why am I waiting to be seated when you have tables for seating?

Overall, Toronto is a mecca for great dining. Wahlburgers just isn't able to compete with the creativity that Toronto Chefs have in concocting interesting burgers\/sandwiches that would lure Torontonians to keep coming back to this mediocre burger joint.

When Walhburgers opened in Toronto I simply wanted to try it for the sake of trying it. After all, a burger monster's gotta eat!

I am aware that the burger chain is a venture by movie star Mark Wahlberg and his brothers, and that there is also a reality TV show based around it. Since I generally don't view reality TV, I can care less what it's about; sounds stupid to me anyhow. However it freaked me out when the first sign posted at the entrance is a legal public film\/photography waiver notice. That's a first in my eating out experience.

No film crew on my visit. But the second thing I saw entering was a throng of people behaving like tourists, gawking and snapping pictures at every detail of the establishment. Walking out after eating here or entering, it seems like I just stepped into a tourist trap. This is not a celebrity chef's place like Susur Lee (who has a restaurant** on the other side of the Soho Metropolitan Hotel building that also houses Wahlburgers). This is a Hollywood celebrity's restaurant, of course you'll feel like you're in a scene and say you've been here! Roll out the red carpet... and get the fuck outta way; this is a food serving establishment, not a TIFF premiere.

The layout is confusing. The front part is dedicated to full service restaurant operations, including waiter service and yes, alcohol! They sure love for you to sit down here. Further back and a couple turns later is the usual and more empty quick service order counter, plus some casual seating that extends to the upper level mezzanine.

As a warning, the menu for burgers only show the price for their 'regular' size. Something I learned the hard way when I was asked if I want the 5oz or 8oz. 5? Only kids eat the 5oz patty! I want the 8 ouncer! Super size that shit; it's the all-American way, right? Upsell wins, well played.

The "Our Burger" 5er is $9.69 on the posted menu, but super sized will run ya $11.65, $13.16 with tax.

And what is this 8oz signature Our Burger? It looked like fast food roadkill to begin with. The 8oz beef patty is an oval shaped elongated thing sandwiched between two microscopic kids meal sized buns, sticking out profoundly like IKEA purchases that could not fit in the car so you drive away with the trunk open. It was pathetically tiny overall, the juices was dripping mad like a horribly leaky faucet, and tasted like a typical fast food chain burger. Nothing special, nothing enjoyable, not impressed. The ingredients were barebones basic--tomatoes, pickles, processed cheese, confetti sized lettuce... if you can belt off the Big Mac song, it pretty much describe what they put in it. It took five minutes to prepare this disappointment for me (whilst waiting for my 4-digit order number to be called--sure felt like Mr. Bean in the waiting room scene, because how many thousand more people could there be before me?), and another five to eat it. A $13 burger should not take me five or less minutes to consume. I felt sorry for the cows who were sacrificed to produce this blasphemous ripoff.

In summary, Wahlboogers is a disappointing, overhyped, and deceptive experience where the star ingredient used is the name itself. Should you go here, do not get the Our Burger, though based on my experience I cannot imagine their other stuff being any more exciting. I felt like I paid for a pack of silver lined underwear for Marky Mark, for it wasn't worth it. With their high prices for small lame products, one could get much better and more enjoyable burgers--be it a fancy gourmet thing or a  greasy thick wonder--elsewhere on the $10-14 range.

** (see http:\/\/www.yelp.ca\/biz\/luckee-toronto?hrid=6DR9vLEHrtemxyh0nPhBHA)

loved the tots and the flavour of my burger was great but the location was underwhelming and looked like the maintenance was ..well neglected.

Staff was friendly enough and service was quick, but for the price, all in all things were underwhelming.

Dare I say Burgers Priest was a step above comparing apples to apples

Ordered the BBQ burger with fries. Tom the burger to be just okay nothing special. They have plenty of seating and the environment was good. However not terribly excited about going back. If I do go back it will be to try a different burger.

I have been very disappointed by this burger joint. I had the Thanksgiving Turkey Burger. Absolutely tasteless! Do yourself a favour and avoid this place. Instead walk a few blocks from there on Adelaide near Simcoe to The Burger's Priest for outstanding burgers.

The food was good I just wish that the "onion rings" wasn't onion straws. I was expecting the normal onion rings :\/.... Also I wish that they had more options for turkey burgers. I wanted to get the bbq burger version but with a turkey burger and they said I couldn't do that. Maybe if u could pick a meat or type of patty first, then choose the type of burger u want. That would be much better. Other than that it's good and in a good location lol

Not sure whether I should classify this place as a sport bar or a fast food burger place. My classic burger (aka Our Burger on the menu) was served cold, too small for me and nothing that I would say omg about. Burger priest is way better than here. Service was slow however since they just opened a few days ago, it will take them few weeks to settle down. Also they charge by default 18% extra for dine-in which is rare for this class of restaurant.

Went there last night with my boyfriend.  I was shocked that the restaurant was not busy at all. To be fair, it's FREEZING outside, so most people do not want to venture too far away from home. 

We walked in, and were promptly seated. Unfortunately, It took forever before someone came over to take our drink order (which is weird because as I said before they were not busy at all).  The burgers were good. I really enjoyed the sweet potato tater tots, did not like the french fries.
 
Overall, I would eat there again if I was in the area, but I would not make a special trip to go there and eat.

Edited to add:  the prices were VERY reasonable, in my opinion.

I know it's a chain style restaurant but I had high expectations given the celebrity status. I love burgers so had to try this place out. We both had the double burger - the signature burger. It's on the smaller side but the thickness makes up for it. It looked really good but sadly was dry and lacked flavour. Website says they cook their burgers to medium but apparently that has changed and they do them well done now. Despite the thousand islands type sauce and American cheddar, it was still quite bland; the burger itself needs more seasoning. The bun was a good though. We also had the sweet potato tater tots and onion rings. Both ok but nothing special. I had a glass of wine and my partner had a sangria which was clearly made from a mix and didn't taste very good. 

We had to point to our drinks on the menu because the server didn't know what Pinot or sangria was.  I mean come on they were both right off the menu. 

$70.00 for all of the above, including tip. Totally not worth it. 

You've disappointed me Marky Mark. I expected more. #wahlburgers #burgersto

This place is pretty good. I ended up coming in here on my own so needed a table for one. They have the convenience of being able to order in and not have wait service. You can also do take-out or come in for full-service restaurant.  A burger and fry cost me $15 with tax. Food was good and the portion sizes were  fair but bordered on small. Seats are comfortable and spacious. bright atmosphere. The waitstaff did not appear too overly enjoy their job. I was greeted at the front door and given instructions on how to proceed. That was good although I was not made to feel overly welcome as if they were excited to see a customer walk to the door. I would come back for sure but would not rush to recommend.

So they opened up a mediocre burger joint. One might say I had high expectations, but if you've watched the show you'll see why I expected so much more. I had the signature "Our Burger" cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, onion, dill pickles and special Wahl sauce. The meat was OK I was hoping for a juicier beef patty, and the bun could be better. Don't get me wrong it's not a bad burge it's just average. I could name other local burger joints that make my mouth water. I do like this restaurant\/bar concept good for groups.

I was extremely excited that Wahlburgers was coming to Toronto, but waited until the hype was over before I gave it a try, plus with the mixed reviews, I didn't make it a priority for my to-go places to try.

For being an establishment from the Wahlberg brothers, I was expecting a great place, good service and amazing food, but was quite disappointed that it didn't deliver according to the hype.  It was comfort food, but at gourmet sizes and prices.

Upon entering through the first door, there's a warning on the wall of being videotaped or recorded, then through the second door, there's brightness from all the greenery decor.  Decent size seating area with full-sized bar and lots of TVs throughout the restaurant.  Like other Yelpers had commented, it felt like I walked into a sports bar.

Luckily there was some sort of walkway that guided me to the ordering counter.  Menu  items were clearly displayed and I thought the prices were quite reasonable because normal prices for good burgers with fries in restaurants ranges from $12 - $18 on average.

I came late Sunday afternoon and there was no line-up, but a group of people waiting for their orders off to the side. The cashier didn't seem friendly and I felt like I had bothered her with my smile while I waited for her to acknowledge me so I can place my order.  

I managed to place my order of BBQ Bacon Burger ($9.95) and Yukon Gold Fries ($3.50), then proceeded to the side to wait while observing the staff.  The two cashiers didn't look happy and the kitchen staff looked miserable from what I saw and it wasn't even that busy. 

Although I indicated that I was dining in to the cashier, receipt showed takeout, hence, my order came in a white paperbag with the Wahlburgers logo even when I tried to stop the other cashier from placing my food in the paperbag informing her I was dining in.  So much for trying to save a paper bag. Nice packaging for the burger and cute container for the fries, but what a major disappointment when I opened the burger box.  I was very shocked to see how small the burger was.  

For the price of $9.95, I was expecting a normal size burger, but what I received was a burger that resembled something slightly larger than a slider. Plus the bun looked like it was manhandled with all the dents on it.  I was hungry, so took a quick photo before taking my first bite.  I wasn't impressed at all.  Too much BBQ sauce that seemed to overpower the burger, cheese wasn't melted all the way, plus I only tasted avocado near the end and almost forgot it was part of the burger.  It seemed like they forgot and only placed a dollop of avocado, perhaps that explained the manhandled bun which didn't taste fresh. The saving grace was the bacon which was done nicely and crispy.

The fries were quite tasty and I ate them plain since it was nicely salted, but for $3.50 it just doesn't seem worth the price for the small amount I received.

I think I would rather have my burger and fries elsewhere.  At least I can say I tried Wahlburgers.  Sadly, this will be my first and last visit.

I really wanted to like this place as I am a fan of the show. Unfortunately the food was not the greatest. Service was excellent though, we were greeted and seated promptly. Waitress was attentive and checked on us multiple times. Decor was fun and felt welcoming. Food wise, my fiance ordered the bbq burger and a cesar salad. I ordered the Our burger with a side of fries and the cookie frappe. We also ordered the mac and cheese to sample. Burger buns were on the cold side and the patty was kinda small and tasteless. Not juicy at all! I think the burger to bun ratio is a bit off, too much bread vs. meat. Cesar salad was a bit tasteless and I think it was due to the fact the lettuce was still wet from being cleaned which diluted the dressing and made the lettuce limp. I would say the tastiest items were my frappe and the mac and cheese. I'm glad they took off the automatic 18% gratuity that I had been reading about because even without it our bill seemed quite expensive for 2 burgers and a couple of sides. Compared to some of the great burger joints in Toronto, Wahlburgers isn't up to par.

I like the TV show; so I was willing to check the place out. This place is so over priced for a McDonald's burger. The bathrooms smelt and were dirty. The upstairs garbage was full and the employees just kept walking by it. Also, when I was walking up the stairs to find a restroom I was cut off by two employees. The only good thing about this place was my server who I gave an extra $20 to and she brought it back. That's the only reason I'm giving it a 2 star not a 1.
